ARIE vol.062, 1939-1943


A. List of copper-plates examined during the year 1939-40.
1
Placement
Mr. P.Sheik Mohideen, Merchantcontractor, Trichinopoly, throughthe late Sir T.Desikacharya.
Year
Western Gaṅga
King
Mādhava Mahārāja (Mā-dhavavarman III).
Date
Śaka 24(?), Sōbha-kṛit, Kārttika,śu. [7], Wednesday,Śravaṇa.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Only a set of photographs of the writtensides of the plates has been received forexamination. The inscription is full ofmistakes in phraseology. Seems to re-cord the grant issued by the king fromTalavanapura, of the village Bhintavāḍisituated in Kuḍugu-nāḍu to a few speci-fied Gāvuṇḍas in appreciation of theirvalour in killing the king's opponentsin a fight and capturing their wives andtreasures.
2
Placement
A resident of Purushottampuri,H.E.H.Nizam's Dominions,through the Director of Archaeo-logy, Hyderabad.
Year
Yādava
King
Rāmachandradēva
Date
Śaka 1232, Sādhā-raṇa.
Language and Script
Sanskrit in Nāgarī
Remarks
Registers the grant of four villages inKānhairī-Khampaṇaka by the king toMahāmaṇḍalika Purushōttama alias Puru-shai-Nāyaka of the Vaśishṭha-gōtra whomade them over as agrahāra to 80 Brāh-maṇas on the day of Kapila-shashṭhīin Bhādrapada of the same year. Givessome details of the king's conquests andthose of his ancestors.
3
Placement
Sri Vēmparla Suryanarayana Sas-tri, Telugu Pandit, Board HighSchool, Amalāpuram, through thelate J.Ramayya Pantulu, Muk-tēśvaram.
Year
Eastern Chāḷukya
King
Sarvalōkāśraya Vishṇu-vardhana Mahārājā-dhirāja.
Date
…
Language and Script
Sanskrit in early characters
Remarks
Records a grant by the king of the villageKōḻūru in Pañchūrikuṟu-vishaya, freeof all taxes to his three generals Bhīmanaand his sons Vijayāditya and Daṇḍi inappreciation of their valour in destroy-ing his enemies in several battles. Thedonee's ancestry is given.
4
Placement
District Judge, Ramnad, Madura
Year
Sētupati
King
Muttu Rāmaliṅga Vija-ya Raghunātha Sētu-pati-kāttadēva.
Date
Śaka 1703, Kali 4882,Śubhakṛit, Uttarā-yaṇa, Vasanta-ṛitu,Vaigāśi, ba.amavāsyā, Monday,Rōhiṇī, Siddhi-yōga, Chatushpāda-karaṇa.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift, made by the king, of thevillage Kuḷavippaṭṭi-pāḍi to a certainSuppiramaṇiya-ayyaṉ, son of RāmaṉŚivaṉ of the Bhāradvāja-gōtra, Āpastan-pa(mba)sūtra and Yajuś-śākhā.
5
Placement
Government Epigraphist for India,Ootacamund.
Year
Eastern Chāḷukya
King
Vikramāditya II
Date
…
Language and Script
Sanskrit in Telugu
Remarks
Records an order of the king to the Rāsh-ṭrakūṭas and others inhabiting the Kaṇḍē-ruvāḍi-vishaya. The grant portion anddate are lost since a later inscription re-corded below was engraved as a palimp-sest over the erased portions of the plate.
6
Placement
Do.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Triyaṁbaka
Date
Śaka 1377 (express-ed by chronogram),Yuva, Kārttika,full-moon, Monday.
Language and Script
Sanskrit in NandiNāgarī
Remarks
Records the grant of the village Bomme-hāḷu renamed Lakshmīpura after hismother, by the king, to the BrāhmaṇaMāchivōkta, son of Vallabhōkta of theŚukla-Yajuś-śākhā.
7
Placement
Sri Virabhadrayya, Kaulūr Math,Sirsi, North Kanara district,through Mr. P.B.Desai of thisoffice.
Year
Biḷigi chiefs
King
Sōmaśēkhara-Nāyaka
Date
Śaka 1631, Virōdhi,Phālguṇa, ba. 5.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records a gift of land belonging to the suburbBalugaṇi alias Chennamallāmbāpura ofBēḍakaṇi-grāma by the queen Chenna-mallammāji to Basavaliṅgadēva, discipleof His Holiness Mahattadēva of Uppina-halli.
8
Placement
Sri Sanjiva Rao Desai, HighCourt Pleader, Gulbarga,Hyderabad State, throughMr. P.B.Desai of this office.
Year
Western Chāḷu-kya.
King
Vinayāditya Satyāś-raya Vallabha.
Date
Śaka 516 (?), Ānanda,Vaiśākha, Paur-ṇamāsī, Thursday,Vyatīpāta.
Language and Script
Sanskrit in Nāgarī
Remarks
Evidently a forgery. Records the grantof the village Niḍagundi in Kisukāḍu-70 by the king to a certain Brāhmaṇaby name Bhāskara Chauvēra-Bhaṭṭaof the Kammeya family and theKāśyapa gōtra. The king is said to havebeen ruling from his capital at Raktapuraon the north bank of the river Malāpa-hārī. The phraseology of the inscriptionis very incorrect. See below Part II,para II.
9
Placement
The residents of Pullūr, Polurtaluk, North Arcot district,through Mr. G.V.Srinivasa Raoof this office.
Year
Pallava
King
Vijaya Nandivarman(II) Pallavamalla.
Date
33rd year
Language and Script
Sanskrit & Tamil in early Pallava characters
Remarks
Records the grant of four villages situatedon the southern bank of the Cheyyār inKīḷvēṇāḍu, a subdivision of Palguṇṛa-kōṭṭaṃ, which were clubbed into one andcalled Nayadhīramaṅgalam after his ownsurname, by the king, as an agrahāra di-vided into shares among 108 learnedBrāhmaṇas of various gōtras and sūtras.The grant was made at the request of hisfeudatory chief Avanichandra-Yuvarāja‘the lord of Vilvalapura’, and the exe-cutor (ājñapti) of the grant was his ministerNāga-Śarma alias Brahmādhirāja.
10
Placement
Sri Kasinath Ganapati DikshitMārigōḷi, Gōkarṇ, North Kanaradistrict, through Mr. P.B.Desaiof this office.
Year
Kadamba
King
Vīra-Kāvadēvarasa(Kāmadēva) ‘rulingfrom his capital atChandāura’.
Date
Śaka 1177, Rāksha-sa, Māgha, śu. 15.Thursday, lunareclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
The king is styled Paśchimasamudrā-dhipati, etc. Records a sarvamānya gift bythe king at the anādi-agrahāra, Mūṟūru tosome Brāhmaṇas.
11
Placement
Sri G.R.Hegade, Teacher, Hule-kal, North Kanara district,through Mr. P.B.Desai of thisoffice.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Vīrapratāpa Harihara-Mahārāya.
Date
Śaka 1326, Svabhā-nu, Phālguṇa, śu.1, Sunday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa & Sanskrit in Nāgarī
Remarks
Records the endowment of the village namedHebbāruvana Taṭṭagāra to Sarvajña-Sarasvati of the Ādityēśvara templeat Gōkarṇa by the ‘Kārṇāta-Mahā-pradhāna’ Īchappa-Vaḍeya of Gōvā, at theinstance of the king, on the occasion of asolar eclipse.
12
Placement
Sri Hāḷatakaṭṭi Gangadhara Bhatof Siddhāpur, North Kanaradistrict, through Mr. P.B.Desaiof this office.
Year
Biḷigi chiefs
King
Sōmaśēkhara-Nāyaka
Date
Śaka 1692, Virōdhi,Śrāvaṇa, śu. 6, Mon-day.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records a gift of land in the village ofSiruvaḷige and the appropriation of itsrevenue for the expenses of worship andofferings and of the car festival in thetemple of god Gaṁgādharēśvara atSidhāpura by Biḷigi Sōmaśēkhara-Nāyaka.
13
Placement
Sri Guggari Virabhadrappa ofSiddhāpur, North Kanara dis-trict, through Mr. P.B.Desai ofthis office.
Year
Biḷigi chiefs
King
Sōmaśēkhara-Nāyaka
Date
Śaka 1638, Manma-tha, Māgha, ba. 10.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records a gift of land in the village of Chika-Biḷilahaḷḷi of the Gutti-vēṇṭhe (subdivision)in Banavāsi 12000 to Mallikārjunadēva,son of Sātenahaḷi Mallappadēva by Chennamallammāji and Sōmaśēkhara-Nāyaka, ‘thegreat lord (Mahāprabhu) of Biḷigi’.
14
Placement
Sri Hāḷatakaṭṭi Gangadhara Bhatof Siddāpur, North Kanara dis-trict, through Mr. P.B.Desai ofthis office.
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
Śaka 1692, VirōdhiŚrāvaṇa, śu. 10.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records a gift of the customs duties on allarticles of merchandise passing through thenāḍu, by the chief, the mahānāḍu, śeṭṭis,etc., for the rathōtsava of god Gaṅgā-dharēśvaradēva near Hāḷitakaṭṭi atSiddāpura.
15
Placement
The Pontiff of the Jaina Bhaṭṭā-kaḷaṁka-maṭha at Sōṇḍa, NorthKanara district, through Mr.P.B.Desai of this office.
Year
…
King
Immaḍi Dēvarāja Oḍeyaru
Date
Śaka 1444, Vishu,Śrāvaṇa, śu. 5,Thursday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Only the last plate of a set, the others beinglost. States that a certain Malli-Śeṭṭimade, after purchase from the chief, asarvamānya endowment (of land) in theMāsūru Mosaḷeyakuṟuvu for the main-tenance of certain services in the Śaṁkha-Jinara-Basti of Huligeṟe, on the advice ofChandraprabhadēva, a disciple of Vijayakīrtidēva of the Dēsi-gaṇa.
16
Placement
The Pontiff of the Sri Baḷaga Bāvā-ji-maṭha, Chicacole, Vizagapatamdistrict, through the Sub-Collec-tion, Chicaccle.
Year
Eastern Gaṅga
King
Dēvēndravarman, son ofof Bhūpēndravarman.
Date
…
Language and Script
Sanskrit in archaic characters
Remarks
Records the royal grant of the villageNāpitavāṭaka in Kōḷuvartani (division)to two learned Brāhmaṇas, viz., Narasiṁha-Bhaṭṭa and his brother Mādhava-Bhaṭṭaof the Kāmukāyana-gōtra, well versedin the Bahvṛicha-Vēda and all the Śāstras,on the occasion of Uttarāyaṇa to securereligious merit for the king and his parents.Published in the Telugu Journal, Bhārati,Vol. XIV, Part 2, pp. 67 ff.
1
Placement
Chārukīrtti Paṇḍitāchāryavaryaof the Jaina Maṭha, Mūḍabidure,Karkala taluk, South Kanaradistrict, through Mr. H.K.Narasimhaswami of this office.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1485, Rudhi-rōdgāri, Mēsha[13,] Friday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records an endowment in money made byŚaṅkaraśeṭṭi alias Biraṇantara at therequest of his sister, Śaṅkaradēvī, for thebenefit of Chaṇḍōgra Pāriśva-Tīrthakara(basti) of Bidure. The grant was madeinto the hands of the Seṭṭikāras at thecommand of Abhinava Chārukīrtti-Paṇḍita.Out of this amount lands were purchased.Records also another endowment of 1250varāhas.
2
Placement
Do.
Year
Biḷigi chiefs
King
Vīrappodeya
Date
Śaka 1468, Viśvā-vasu, Kārttika śu. 1;and Parābhava, Pra-thama Āshāḍha,śu. 10.
Language and Script
Sanskrit & Kannaḍa in Kannaḍa
Remarks
Gives the ancestry of the chief for six genera-tions. Records the gift, by the chief, ofthe income from certain lands in thevillage Kuḍuginabayalu included in theChikkamāḷige-nāḍu for worship in thebasti called Tribhuvanachūḍāmaṇi atBidure. Records also a gift by the chiefof a silver cup and of money for theprovision of rice-offering to god Chandra-nātha in the (same) basti in the name ofVīramamma, the wife of his uncle Timma-rasa. Refers also to a gift of money for themilk-bath of the deity in the name ofTimmappa, son of Ghaṇṭoḍeya.
3
Placement
Do.
Year
…
King
Date
Śaka 1493, Pra-jōtpatti, Pushya,śu. 8, Sunday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records an endowment of land at Marakatain Mīchāra-māgāṇe for āhāradāna (feeding)in the basti (at Bidure) by Abbakkadēvīof the Chaüṭa (family) for the merit ofher sister Padumaladēvī. Contains theinjunction that the chiefs of Puttige shouldnot destroy the charity.
4
Placement
Do.
Year
…
King
Date
Śaka 1554, Āṅgirasa,Dīvāḷi.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that the two sections of Jaina residentsliving in Beṭṭakēri and Mādalaṅgaḍikēriat Bidure, who were celebrating the Dīvāḷifestivals hitherto by mutual fights withsticks, slings, stones and shields, were, bysolemn vow, made to give up this violentmethod as it was against the tenets oftheir faith and to observe the festival infuture by harmless diversions of dīpā-rādhana and other special worship in theChandranātha-basti, at the instance andintercession of their Pontiff, Samanta-bhadradēva of the Sēna-gaṇa who, withthe assistance of his immediate disciplesand the ascetics of the four gaṇas and theactive sympathy of his friend Dēvaṇṇa,brought pressure upon them by threatsof suicide by starvation.
4a
Placement
Chārukīrtti Paṇḍitāchāryavaryaof the Jaina Maṭha, Mūḍabidure,Karkala taluk, South Kanaradistrict, through Mr. H.K.Narasimhaswami of this office.
Year
Keḷadi
King
Veṅkaṭappa-Nāyaka
Date
Śaka 1544, Rudhi-rōdgāri, Vaiśākha.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records separately in the same plate theearlier activities of this Samantabhadrawho is stated to have visited the king atIkkēri and his local officer Chinna-bhaṇḍāra Dēvappa and secured theirfinancial and official assistance for therenovation of the chaityālaya calledTribhuvanatilaka, dedicated to Chandranā-thasvāmi at Bidure.
5
Placement
Do.
Year
…
King
Lakshmapparasa aliasBhaira[ra*]sa ‘of theKadaṁba family’.
Date
Śaka 1426 (expired)Krōdhin, Āśvīja, ba.5.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that the chief conceded certainecclesiastical rights and privileges oversome part of his dominions to a discipleof Chārukīrtti Paṇḍitāchārya, the highpontiff of the 72 religious saṁsthānas ofthe Jainas.
6
Placement
Do.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Vijaya Sadāśiva Mahārā-ya ‘ruling at Vidyāna-gara’.
Date
Śaka 1679, Rākshasa,Mārgaśira, śu. 1.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records an endowment of certain lands inthe village Beṇṇegāve in the Sōde provinceby the chief Immaḍi Arasappoḍeya, sonof Arasappa-oḍeya of Sōde, to his teacherChārukīrtti Paṇḍitadēva who bears anumber of birudas like Rāya-rājaguru, etc.
7
Placement
Do.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Durmukhi, Vṛisha-bha, 15, Sunday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records that Barmananda and his young-er brother Kuṅgiya Barmiseṭṭi of theKarbarabaḷi agreed to pay into the trea-sury of the basadi of Chaṇḍōgra Parśva-dēva built by Chārukīrti Paṇḍitadēva,600 gadyāṇas from out of theincome of lands in their enjoyment. Alsorecords another endowment of 110gadyāṇas from the Vṛiśchika month ofthe Hēviḷaṁbi year by the same brothers.
8
Placement
Do.
Year
Keḷadi
King
Vīrabha dra-Nāyaka‘ruling the Maṅgaḷūruand Bārakūru king-dom’.
Date
Śaka 1562, Vikrama,Mārgaśira, ba. 2,Friday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records an agreement given in the presenceof Narasiṁhoḍeya who was holding themudra of Maṅgaḷūru by ChikkarāyaOḍeya of Puttige belonging to the Chauṭafamily to Abhinava Chārukīrtti Paṇḍita-dēva and the several seṭṭis and others ofthe mercantile guild of Bidure undertaking not to encroach, in future, upon the-civic rights and privileges hitherto enjoyed.by the latter and to preserve intact theproperty of the gods and the priests sincethe excesses of his subordinates hadresulted in their abandoning their homesand settling elsewhere.
9
Placement
Do.
Year
…
King
…
Date
(a) Tāraṇa, Vṛisha-bha, 22, Thursday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
(a) Records an endowment of 200 honnufor offerings to the 24 Tirthaṅkarasby Chandrakīrttidēva. This amount wasadvanced to a certain Vishṇu-Kalūṁvaru (?) who mortgaged some ofhis lands for the amount received andagreed to pay 16 maunds of rice as interest thereon every year.
9
Placement
Year
…
King
…
Date
(b) Svabhānu, Karka-[ṭaka] 9, Wednesday
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
(b) Records a similar agreement enteredinto with the treasury of the Pārśavanāthabasti at Bidure by Śrīdhara-paḍikōdi, whoafter mortgaging his lands, received 2100Vīrarāya-phaṇa and agreed to pay asinterest thereon 28 muḍe of rice everyyear. This was to be utilised for providingofferings and worship to the bronze imageof the deity in the basti set up by Lalitā-dēvī of Gerasoppe.
9
Placement
Year
…
King
…
Date
(c) Nandana, Mēsha,prathamā, Sunday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
(c) The third record is an agreement bythree brothers to pay a fixed sum everyyear as interest for the amount borrowedby them from the basti of Pārśvnātha outof the endowments made by Lalitādēvī.
10
Placement
Do.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1671, Śukla,Māgha, ba. 13.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records a gift of money to reclaim a land atPaduvakōḍu in Perañjada-māgāṇe whichhad been endowed by his ancestors forworship in the basti of Chandranātha-svāmiat Mūḍabidure, by Timmaṇarasa aliasAchela, as the land had becomefallow after sometime and consequentlyworship in the basti had stopped.
11
Placement
Do.
Year
.
King
…
Date
Yuva, Mithuna, 16,Thursday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records the mortgage of his lands for 15years by Mañjiseṭṭi of Pejāra to theseveral seṭṭikāras of Bidure for 200varāhas of gold received by him from thetreasury of the basti of ChaṇḍōgraPārśvadēva at the instance of (the pontiff)Abhinava-Chārukīrtti Paṇḍitadēva.
12
Placement
Do.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1643, Plava,Māgha, śu. 10.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records a gift of land to the Kallu-basti ofChandranātha-svāmi at Mūḍabidure bySātabeḷe-Ballāḷa of Marōvōḍi-grāma inKeḷada-māgāṇe, a subdivision of Achela-sīme. The land was entrusted to a ladyby name Chandramati-avva Biyyāni forperforming the Śalākshaṇika-nōhi (festi-val) in the basti.
13
Placement
Coārukīrtti Paṇḍitāchāryavarya ofthe Jaina Maṭha, Mūḍabidure,Karkala taluk, South Kanara dis-trict, through Mr. H.K.Narasim-haswami of this office.

14
Placement
Lokanathacharya of the sameplace through Mr. H.K.Nara-simhaswami of this office.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Raudri, Mēsha, 15,Sunday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seems to record an endowment in money forofferings to the images of Chandranāthaand Ananta-Tīrthakara by two brothersGōvindāsraṇa and Rāmāsraṇa of Yēṇūru(Vēṇūr) who pledged their brahmadēyalands for the purpose, redeemable bythemselves only after a period of 40years.
15
Placement
Do.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1544, Dur-mati, Kārtikka,śu. 1, Saturday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records an endowment in lands for theperformance of pañchāmṛita and other ritesto the image of Śāntīśvara, Vardhamānaand Pañchaparamēshṭhī by RāmanāthaArasaru of Kabiyara-baḷi in the time ofMadurakadēvī alias Ammājī, the discipleof Lalitakīrti Bhaṭṭāraka of the Śāntīśvara-chaityālaya of Yēṇūr.
16
Placement
Secretary, Gandhi Museum, Ka-nara High School, Mangalore.
Year
Keḷadi
King
Basavappa-Nāyaka
Date
Śaka 1621, Bahu-dhānya, Chaitra,śu. 15.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records an endowment of land by Basappa-Nāyaka, son of Sōmaśēkhara-Nāyaka of Ke-ḷadi to a maṭha constructed at the villageof Māḷari Kaḍagēri in Munnināḍa-sīme byĀnemahal Vīraṇṇa in clearance of a debtowed by the former to the latter.
17
Placement
Sri Prasad Ganapa VenkataramanaBhat of Gōkarṇa, Bombay Pre-sidency, through Mr. P.B.Desaiof this office.
Year
Biḷigi chiefs
King
Sōmaśēkhara-Nāyaka
Date
Śaka 1608, Krōdha-na, Chaitra, ba. 12.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records an endowment of money to bederived annually from several sources, bythe chief for the performance of variousservices to the god Mahābalēśvara ofGōkarṇa.
18
Placement
Subordinate Judge, Guntur
Year
Reḍḍi
King
Ana-Vēma Reḍḍi
Date
Śaka 1300, Kāḷayuk-ta, Mārga[śira], śu. 15Saturday, lunareclipse.
Language and Script
Sanskrit & Telugu in Telugu
Remarks
Grant of village Pedapalkalūru by theking to Ahōbala-Paṇḍita of the Hari-ta-gōtra as an agrahāra near Maṅgaḷagirion the southern banks of the Kṛishṇā tobe shared by him with 8 other Brāhmaṇasas vṛitti.
19
Placement
Sri Chelikivāḍa Venkatakrishna-yya of Pūḍēru village, throughthe Deputy Tahsildar, Sulurpettaluk, Nellore district.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Dēvarāya
Date
Śaka 1347 (expressedby chronogram),Viśvāvasu, śu. 12.
Language and Script
Sanskrit in Nāgarī
Remarks
Records the grant by the king, of thevillage Dēvarāyapuram divided intoshares among Brāhmaṇas of various gōtras.
20
Placement
The Secretary, KarnatakaHistorical Research Society,Dharwar.
Year
Do.
King
Sadāśivarāya
Date
Śaka 1481, Siddhār-thin, Āśvayuja, śu.8, Sunday, Uttar-āshāḍha.

Kannaḍa in Malayāḷam

King

Date

Language and Script
Marāṭhī & Kannaḍa in Nāgarī
Remarks
In characters of about the 13th century A.D.The language seems to be a corrupt dialectof Mahrāṭhī with an admixture of oldKannaḍa. Purports to record a grant ofland at Maṇināga-grāma in Kuṇḍi 3000province to twelve gāvuṇḍas of the placeby the king, on the occasion of his victori-ous campaign in the southern region whilehe was camping on the bank of theMalāpahārī river at Kōḷanūr, probably inrecognition of some service rendered bythem.

Placement
Sri Annamalai Mudaliar, Appar-maḍam, Tiruvaṇṇāmalai, NorthArcot district, through Mr. V.Venkatasubba Ayyar of this office.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Kṛishṇadēva Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 14[3]5, Āṅgiras,Makara, śu. 5, Thurs-day, Uttirāḍam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records an endowment of the village Mēl-Pālaiyūr and of 400 poṉ in cash by theking for worship and offerings to the imagesof Aḻiyāviradaṅgoṇḍa-Vināyaka andAppar Taṁbirānār which had been setup in the Periyanāṭṭumaḍam built by thenāṭṭavar of the 84 vaḷanāḍus outside thetemple of Aruṇādri-Īśvara near the maingōpura at the instance of Aḻiyāvira-daṅkoṇḍa-Taṁbirānār and for sacredbath and offerings during one service of theday for the god Aruṇādri-Īśvara and god-dess Uṇṇāmulaiammaṉ. Further, it recordsan agreement among these 84 nāṭṭavar tocollect certain imposts among themselveson specified occasions for the main-tenance of a feeding charity in the maṭha,and the appointment of a person by themto look after the management ofthe affairs of the maṭha. In the pre-amble of the inscription reference ismade to the construction of the 1000pillared maṇḍapa by the king within theprecincts of the temple at Tiruvaṇṇāmalaiin the place occupied by the Periyanāṭṭu-maṭam after paying a compensation of 500poṉ to the latter (Cf. No. 574 of 1902).

Placement
The Tahsildar, Gurazala, Gunturdistrict, through Mr. G.C.Chandra, Archaeological Super-intendent, Southern Circle,Madras.
Year
Eastern Chāḷuk-ya.
King
Jayasiṁhavallabha-Mahārāja (I)
Date
30th year, Āśvayuja,śu. [5], Chandravāra,Śravaṇa.
Language and Script
Sanskrit in early Telugu characters
Remarks
Records the grant of the village Kōṇekiin Paḷḷi-rashṭra by Vishṇuvardhana-Mahā-rāja, son of Indravarma-Mahārāja, theyounger brother of the ruling king, onthe occasion of the lunar eclipse in themonth of Māgha. The village was dividedinto 120 shares and allotted to severalBrāhmaṇas in specified proportion. Re-fers to a previous donee of part of thevillage by name Vidu-Śarmā of Ātukūru,the son of Mahāsēna-Śarmā, who is saidto have been known as Adyakāla-Vararu-chi on account of his great scholarship.

King
Siṁhavarma Mahārāja
Date

Language and Script
Sanskrit in Pallava characters
Remarks
Registers the grant of the village Neḍuṅ-garāya in Muṇḍarāshṭra, by Yuvama-hārāja Vishṇugōpavarman, the son ofSkandavarman, the grandson of Vīra-varman and the great-grandson of Skanda-varman of the Bhāradvāja-gōtra, tothe three donees Doḍḍisvāmin, Kaṇṇa-svāmin and Nandisvāmin, of whom the firstis given half the share, the second two-thirds of the remaining half, and the thirdthe rest of the village which was con-verted into a Śāraṇikayrāma (asylum) andwas exempted from the 18 kinds of imposi-tions (?), the dēvabhōga lands in it being setapart. These exemptions were orderedto be maintained by the state officers suchas the āyuktakas, naiyōgikas, rājavallabhasetc. (Edited in the Telugu Journal, BhāratiVol. XVIII, part I, pp. 699 ff.)

…

Telugu
Remarks
Records that Pedda Hōbaḷa Reḍḍi, adminis-tering the six samutus under Mahāṃaḍalēś-vara Mahārāja Śrī Munnā Kṛishṇarāyala-vāru ruling from Penugoṇḍa-paṭṭaṇa,having undertaken to go on a pilgrimageto Ahōbilam to fulfil a vow made by hisforefathers, was instructed by the god, in adream, to construct a temple for him atŚāṇḍilya-kshētra near Sōmaghaṭṭa, where-in he (the god) would appear as MadhugiriLakshmī-Narasiṁha, and that havingconstructed the temple accordingly hesecured the village Kanirāḷḷapalle in theGōraṇtla-samutu to the god as rāyadattifrom the king and also arranged for en-dowments for an archaka to conduct wor-ship of the god.

Sanskrit & Telugu
Remarks
Records grant of land in the village ofMaṇḍa in Guddavāḍi-vishaya, by theking to Āṁkaya alias Samastabhuvanā-śraya Brahmamahārāja, son of Rāmadēvaand grandson of Śivakumārabhaṭṭa of theBhāradvāja-gōtra and Āpastaṁba-sūtra.The land granted is stated to have beenmeasured by the rod called Mummaḍi-Bhīmakōla. Published in Bhārati, Vol. XX,pt. 2, pp. 177-193.
7
Placement
Śiva temple at Śivagaṅga, Ram-nad, through the RevenueDivisional Officer, Devakottai.
Year
Sētupati
King
VijayaraghunāthaSētupati.
Date
Śaka 1673, Prajōt-patti, Uttarāyaṇa,Māgha, ba. 13, Śra-vaṇa, Śivarātri.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the construction of the Śiva templeon the east bank of the tank at Chaturvē-dimaṅgalam alias Śivagaṅgai and the con-secration of the god and goddess thereinunder the name of Śaśivarṇa Īśvarasvāmiand Periyanāyaki Ammaṉ and the en-dowment of land for their worship byprince Mudduvaḍuganātha-Periya-uḍai-yārttēvar. The king, among other birudas,bears the title Araśu-nilaiyiṭṭa Śaśivarṇa-ttēvar.
8
Placement
Do.
Year
Do.
King
Muddu VaḍuganāthaPeriya Uḍaiyāttēvar,son of Araśu-nilaiyiṭṭaVijaya RaghunāthaŚaśiva rṇap-Periya-Uḍaiyār.
Date
Śaka 1674, Āṅgiras,Aṟpaśi 5, Tuesday,śu. 10, Vijaya-daśamī, Aviṭṭam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the grant of a fresh deed in place ofthe old one said to have been lost, bymembers of the Kammāḷa community ofŚivagaṅga, assembled in the temple ofŚaśivarṇa-Īśvara on the bank of thetank in their village agreeing to pay asmall levy to meet some of the require-ments of the temple.
9
Placement
Senior Ināmdār of Kumārapāḷa-yam agrahāram, through theTahsildar of Tiruchchengode.
Year
Mysore chiefs
King
Kṛishṇarāja Oḍeya
Date
Śaka 1682, Vikrama,Viśākha, śu. 3.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers sale of the village Tagudappāḍiwith its 14 hamlets included in the hōbaḷiof Śaṁkhagiri to four Brāhmaṇas for 50,000Rājagōpāla-rarāhas.
10
Placement
Trustee, Śembonnāthasvāmin tem-ple, Āṇḍānkōvil, Papanasamtaluk, Tanjore district.
Year
…
King
Muttu Vijaya Raghu-nātha Periya-Uḍaiyār-ttēvar ‘the ruler ofŚivagaṅgai-rājya’.
Date
Śaka 1711, Kali 4890,Saumya, Paṅguṉi15, śu. 10, Thurs-day, Pūśam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records gift of the village Mīṉāppūr in theŚākkai taluk of the Śivagaṅga division byAṭṭavaṇai Māyāṇḍiyā-Piḷḷai for worship inthe temple of Śeṁbināthasvāmin at Teṉpu-ttūr alias Āṇḍānkōvil in the Chōḷa country.

APPENDIX B


List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1939-40.


CUDDAPAH DISTRICT SIDDHAVATTAM TALUK
1
Placement
Aṭlūru.--Two fragments of a slab lyingnear the Gaṅgamma temple.
Year
Kākatīya
King
[Ru]dradēva-Mahārāja, ‘lord of Anu-makoṇḍapura’.
Date
Śaka 1190, [Pra]bha-va, Phālguṇa, śu.15, Thursday.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Fragmentary. Registers certain grants of money-income madefor the worship of the god, probably at Jyōti by a subordi-nate (name lost) of the king, of whose titles Maṇḍalika-brahmarākshasa and Jagaddaḷa-Gaṇḍapeṇḍāra are preserved.
2
Placement
Slab lying in a field about a furlong to theeast of the Gaṅgamma temple.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivarāyadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1464, Parā-bhava (wrong),Āshāḍha, ba. 14.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Registers the grant of several taxes such as Kaṭṭapannu (?)Kāṇike, Veṭṭikūḍam and Dommaripannu to the barber,Koṇḍōju of Aṭlūru, by Māḍrāja Rāmarājayyadēva-Mahārājaat the instance of Rāmarāja and with the permission of theking.
3
Placement
Brāhmaṇapalle.--Slab set up in the tank-bed to the north of Gaṭṭupalle.
Year
Kāyastha
King
Aṁbadēva-Mahārāja
Date
Saka 1212, Vikṛita,Bhādrapada, śu. 5,Thursday.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged. Records the construction of the tank at Rāvula-kolanu, the demarcation of its boundaries and gift of someland (?) by Mahāpradhāni Gōḍerāya Gaṅgidēvayaṁgāru.
4
Placement
Chelamāreḍḍipalle.--Slab set up nearthe well on the way to Ponnavōlu.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Characters are of the 17th century A.D. Registers a grant ofland as baṭṭayitu (bhaṭṭavṛitti)-mānyam made by the sthānikasof the Ishṭakāmīśvara and Bhairavēśvara temples to Kāma-rusu Timmayaṁgāru for having constructed a tank andchannels at Ponnavōlu.
5
Placement
Cheṇḍuvāyi.--Slab in a field (SurveyNo. 50) near the satra.
Year
Kākatīya
King
Pratāparudra
Date
Śaka 1241, [Si]ddhār-thin, Śrāvaṇa, śu.15, Wednesday.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
States that while Mahāpradhāni Juṭṭaya-Leṁka was rulingover Pottapi, Sakhali and Mulkināṇḍu, his younger brotherRudraya-Leṁka, who was staying at Kaḍapa in Mulki-nāṇḍu, having taken a sacred bath on the day of the lunareclipse, granted for the merit of the king, the several incomessuch as the rācha-śrōtriyam, the arigōru-pannu, kāṇika, etc.,in the village Cheṇḍuvāyi, situated in Sakhali-bhūmi, for themidday offerings of the god Siddhanātha.
6
Placement
Slab set up near the temple of Ellamma
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1694, Nandana,Chaitra, śu. 15.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Registers grants of land made by the Reḍḍi and Karaṇam ofthe village to Ellamma, the village goddess situated on thebank of the Pinākinī and the god Mallēśvara of Kūrmagiri.
7
Placement
Step leading into the well called ‘Pedda-bhāvi.’
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Telugu (archaic)
Remarks
In characters of about the 8th century A.D. Mentions acertain Bōdaṟāviti and seems to refer to some writing exe-cuted by Bārāṇuṇḍu in accordance with the former's wish (?).
8
Placement
Chiṭṭāyapalle. (hamlet of Malinēnipaṭ-ṇam).--Broken slab lying near the ruinedtemple of Śiva to the east of the village.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1172, Sādhāra-ṇa, Pushya, Ar-dhōdaya.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged and fragmentary. Registers certain grants of landmade by Mahāsāmanta Kāṭama-Nāyaka, and his brother,for the merit of their overlord.
9-12
Placement
Doṅgalasāni.--(hamlet of Kuruguṇṭa-palle).--Slab set up by the side ofthe image of Āñjanēya.
Year
Telugu-Chōḍa
King
Nallasiddharasa-Dēvachōḍa-Mahārāja
Date
Śaka 1081, Pramādi,Māgha, śu. 15, Ar-dhōdaya.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records that Nallachiddarasa (Nallasiddharasa) ruling atNellūrupaṭṭaṇa, having started out on a campaign of victory,his subordinates Mahāpradhāni, Sandhivigrahi Rēvaṇa-Heg-gaḍe and his brother Pōtaṇa-Heggaḍe encountered.Mallidēva and Sōmēśvaradēva, the chiefs of Pottapidēśa, atDoṅgalasāni and that the former, i.e., Rēvaṇa-Heggaḍehaving routed Mallidēva and killed Sōmēśvaradēva alongwith twelve other chiefs and a thousand men, dispersedseveral others and lost his life in the battle field. Hisbrother Pōtaṇa-Heggaḍe, along with others, having reportedthe success of the fight to his overlord Nallachiddarasa,installed perpetual lamps at the mahāsthānas of Mallikār-juna, Tripurāntaka, Siddhavaṭa, Aṇaṁpura and Māhēśvarafor the merit of his brother and himself. Also records thepratishṭhā of a Vishṇu image at the frontier of Peḍanāḍuand the endowment of 10 vṛittis of land made to it by Kāvaṇa-Heggaḍe, son of Rēvaṇa-Heggaḍe, for the merit of his parentsRēvaṇa and Dāramāmbike. The Telugu (in Telugu andNāgarī characters) and Tamil versions of the same inscrip-tion are written in order after the above. The Tamil version,besides mentioning the above details, adds that Sōmēśvaraand Mallidēva were the sons of Vimalāditya and that theinscription was engraved in the time of Kulōttuṅgadēva.
13
Placement
Slab lying in front of the Āñjanēya temple
Year
Telugu-Chōḍa
King
Vaṁkeya-Chōla Mahārāja
Date
[4]1st regnal year (inwords), Chiṭṭe(Chaitra), [śu.]daśami, Sunday.
Language and Script
Telugu (archaic)
Remarks
Commences with the praśasti ‘Svasti charaṇa-sarōruha’, etc.;registers grants of land made by the king, who bears thetitles Teṅkaṇāditya, Komarara-Bhīma and Pusiyilladāmta, tothe goddess Kuruva-Bhaṭāri. The characters belong toabout the 9-10th century A.D.

Year
Vijayanagara
King
Dēvarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Hēviḷaṁbi
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Seems to register a remission of some tolls in favour of acertain individual (name lost).

Year

Language and Script
Prakrit in Brāhmī
Remarks

18
Placement
Two broken slabs lying in Survey No. 186
Year
Vijayanagara
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
The beginning of the inscription on one slab is lost. It regis-ters a gift of taxes collected at the Li gāla-tīrtha by theReḍḍis and Karaṇas of Gaṅgapērūru to the goddess Vuṭa-laṁma of the village, the goddess Gaṇa-Kalidēvī of Māṁ-chupalle and other deities for the annual worship. Theother inscription which is a fragment refers to (god) Rāmaseated on the throne in the E1kavīra-mukhamaṇḍapa atMāchupalle and to the śeṭṭis, who were probably the devoteesof the god. The characters of both the inscriptions belongto about the 15th century A.D.
19
Placement
Slab set up in Survey No. 136 near theimage of Vīrabhadra.
Year
Do.
King
Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1481, Siddhār-thin, Āshāḍha, śu.12, Friday.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks

31
Placement
Kōṭapāḍu.--Slab in the Āvulamāla, 1(1/2)miles to the west of the village.
Year
…
King
…
Date

Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks

33
Placement
Māchupalle.--Slab set up near a wellcalled Guruvi Reḍḍi-bhāvi near theruined temple of Śiva.
Year
…
King
Traiḷōkyamalla Sōmidēva-Mahārāja
Date
Śaka [11]78, Rāk-shasa, Karkaṭaka,śu. Paurṇamāsī,Tuesday, Tiruvōṇam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the grant of the village Māśaruppaḷḷi near the southerngateway of Śrīparvata by Gaṅgaiyasāhaṇiyār, thechief of Vallūr in Mutti-vaḷanāḍu, to a certainKālaḍi Vāsudēva-Nāyakar of Malaimaṇḍalam,who in turn endowed some lands therein forearly morning service in the temple of Siddavaḍam-uḍaiya-Nāyaṉār and for feeding Sanyāsis and Brāhmaṇas comingfrom Malai-maṇḍalam.
34
Placement
Māḍapūru.--Slab lying near the image ofMādhavarāya on the hill to the west ofthe village.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1451, Virōdhin,Kārttika, śu. 1[5].
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Records a gift of land at Māḍa-pūru made by Pōtināyani Nāgamanāyaniṅgāru to Mādha-vayaṁgāru, the Karaṇam of the village, probably for theworship of god [Tiru]veṅgaḷanātha. The village Māḍupūruis stated to have been included in the Udayagiri-durga andto have been given to the donor by Ayyaparusu-Nāyaṁkulu,son of Rāyasam Timmarusu.
35
Placement
Maddulēṭigaḍḍa (hamlet of Kuruguṇ-ṭapalle)--Slab lying on the hillock westof the tank.

King
Tirukāletidēva-Chōḍa-Mahārāja ‘rulingat Kāñchīpuram’.

Telugu

Telugu

…

…

Śaka 1780, Śubhakṛit(wrong).
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a gift of ten rupees per annum, made by Peda-Narasayya and Pina-Narasayya, sons of Narasayya forburning lamps in front of god Rāmasvāmin.

53
Placement
Rāchāyapēṭā (hamlet of Chintarāju-palle).--Slab set up on the tank bund.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1710, Saumya,Māgha, ba. 5, Fri-day, Hastā.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
States that Appalreḍḍi-Gaṅgireḍḍi, Peda-Pōlreḍḍi, Veṅgal-reḍḍi and China-Pōlreḍḍi, sons of Kaluvāyi Buchchi-Rāmi-reḍḍi Nārāyaṇamma, having decided to construct a tankacross the Tummalayēru at Rāchāyapalle, Ādūri Pāpireḍḍi,the Reḍḍis and Saṁbaṭūri Rāmachandruḍu and others,and the Karaṇams of the village obtained permission of thegovernment (divāṇaṁvāru), constructed the tank, establishedan agrahāra on śu. 15 in Māgha in the year Ānanda, on theoccasion of a lunar eclipse, and settled in it Brāhmaṇas of thethree sects granting them 10 vṛittis of land. Also givesdetails of the taxes levied on lands cultivated under thetank, the mānyas given to the bōyas who constructed thetank and to the others who were entrusted with its upkeep.

Tamil
Remarks
Records a royal gift of the village Tavaśi-Perumbākkam inPārāśūr-nāḍu, a subdivision of Attippaṟṟu, free of taxes asdēvadāna, for meeting the expenses of the Vīra-Pāṇḍyaṉ-śandi instituted in the name of the king in the temple byMuṉaiyadaraiyar alias Kaṇḍiyadēvar, and for offerings andfestival in the month of Āṉi.

106
Placement
Do.
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
17th year (in words)
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
States that the village Śiṟṟiyāṟṟūr mentioned above wasresumed by Vikramaśōḻa-Śambuvarāya, and that Dāmō-daraṉ Perumāṇḍi-Nāyaka, with the permission of Gaṇḍa-gōpāla, got back half of this village as dēvadāna of the temple,while the other half was assigned as maḍappuṟam for feedingitinerant Māhēśvaras in the Puṭpagiri (Pushpagiri)-jīyar-maṭha. This new order was engraved in the temple withthe permission of Vīrapperumāḷ alias Ediriliśōḻa-Śambu-varāyaṉ.

Year

Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that on information being received from his officersMādirāja Chennaya and Chokka-Nāyiṉār that the villageand the temple lands were completely washed away by thefloods, the king remitted an amount of 150 honnu (gold)out of the jōḍi, śūlavari, paṭṭaḍai and nūlāyam due from thetemple and the village, to provide for the repair of thebreaches and for conducting festivals in the temple.

144
Placement
Slab set up in front of the same temple
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Kṛishṇadēva-Mahārāya, son of Nara-siṁhadēva-Mahārāya.
Date
Śaka 1431, Śukla,Makara, śu. 10,Thursday, Punar-pūśam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
States that owing to the levy of jōḍi tax on temple lands byRāmappa-Nāyaka, the Mugappāvāḍai officer of Narasiṁha-rāya, many temples became neglected, and that Krishṇa-dēvarāya, on the occasion of his accession to the throne,made all the dēvadāna lands sarvamānya including thosebelonging to the Jaina and Buddhist temples in Paḍaivīṭṭu-rājya, and Chandragiri-rājya, by which the Jaina templeVīrarājēndraśōḻapperumbaḷḷi at Karandai was also bene-fited.

Remarks
Built in the middle. Begins with the introduction Tiru-maṉṉi vaḷara, etc. Seems to record an agreement given bythe ūrār of Paṟambūr to measure out a specified quantityof paddy in the temple for the money endowed by a certainPaṇḍārakkiḻāṉ Ravi of the village. On the top of thisinscription is a record of two lines stating that a certainOttūr Śivaṉ set up a pāda-pīṭha for Mahādēva.

VELLORE TALUK
173
Placement
Tippasamudram.--Stone called ‘Śūlak-kal’ set up in the village.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Śrīraṅgadēva-Mahā-rāya.
Date
Śaka 1497, Yuva,Makara, ba. trayō-daśi, Wednesday.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift of the village Vaḻiviḷattimaṅgalam aliasTippasamudram by Chiṉṉa Bommu-Nāyaka of Vēlūr withthe permission of Kṛishṇappa-Nāyaka and Śrīraṅgadēva-Mahārāya to the temple of Jvarakaṇṭhēśvara-svāmi atVēlūr. The other face of the stone contains in relief thefigures of a śūla, sun and moon.

Placement
Same wall
Year
…

…

Remarks

199
Placement
West wall of same prākāra
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Viruppaṇṇa-Uḍaiyar, son of Hari-hararāya.
Date

Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Purports to be an order of the god granting 7(1/2) vēli of land andhouse-sites for adhyayana to the Uttiran-bhaṭṭas (Rudra-bhaṭṭas) under the lake Okkaniṉṟāṉ-ēri instead of at Śivaṉ-agaram alias Umāpati-chaturvēdimaṅgalam as the latterproved unsuitable for their living.
200
Placement
Same wall
Year
Do.
King
Bukkaṇa-Uḍaiyar, son of Harihara-Mahārāja.
Date

Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Purports to be an order of Chaṇḍēśvara-Nāyinār ratifying thegrant of 3 vēli of land under the tank at Paśumāttūr aliasMaratakavallinallūr belonging to the god Vaḻittuṇai-Nāyaṉār,and a house-site in the Śeyyāṟṟuveṉṟāṉ-tiruvīdi at Tiruvi-riñchipuram by the ūravar to Tiruvāñjiyamuḍaiyār, amaṭhapati-māhēśvara of the place, for a maṭha and for feed-ing therein five Māhēsvaras daily, in consideration of hisefforts in having the tank dug.
201
Placement
North wall of the same prākāra
Year
Pāṇḍya
King
Tribh. Kulaśēkharadēva
Date
25th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Portions left unengraved in the middle. Seems to recordgift of cows to the temple, by Amarakōṉ alias Periyāṉ,a shepherd of Tiruvallam.
202
Placement
Same wall
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Prauḍha Immaḍi Mallikārjunadēva-Mahārāya, son of Dēvarāya Bhūpa-tirāya, ‘who witnessed the elephanthunt.’
Date
Sarvajit, Mēsha, śu.10, Rōhiṇī, Friday.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the grant of the hereditary right of tirunundāviḷa-kku-kuḍi for the maintenance of a perpetual lamp in thetemple, to Varitta-kōṉ, a shepherd of Śevvūr alias Pāḍi.
203
Placement
Do.
Year
Do.
King
mallikārjunarāya, son of Dēvarāya-Mahārāya, ‘who witnessed the ele-phant hunt.’
Date
Śaka 1370, Prabhava,Mēsha, śu. 1, Utti-rāḍam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records a similar assignment, by Deyvaṅgaḷ-Perumāḷ Vayirava-Nāyiṉār, of the tirunundāviḷakku-kuḍi right of the templeof Vaḻittuṇai-Nāyiṉār, to the sons of the shepherd Ariyāṅkōṉ.
204
Placement
Two stones found in the third prākāraof the same temple, now kept in thefirst prākāra.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
One of the pieces seems to record a gift of land as tirumaḍa-viḷāgam for the temple of Ādīśvaramuḍaiyār. The othermentions a vaittīyka-bhāga.
205
Placement
Another stone removed to the same place
Year
Chōḷa
King
Madiraikoṇḍa Parakēsarin
Date
[3]rd year (in words)
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. Refers to a cattle raid and records the death ofa warrior whose figure, holding in his hands a bow and anarrow, is cut in relief beside the inscription,. This inscrip-tion is published in South Indian Inscriptions, Vol. I,No. 126, where, however, only the first two lines are given.
206
Placement
Third stone in the same place
Year
Pallava
King
Nandivikramavarman
Date
9th year (in words)
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Fragment. Mentions Viḍēlviḍugu. Published in South IndianInscriptions, Vol. I, No. 124, where only the first two linesare given. Seems to record a royal order to the Nagarattārof Śeruvālai-maṅ[galam*] making a sarvaparihāra gift.
207
Placement
Fourth stone set up in the same place
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
47th year (in words)
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. Mentions Kalanippā[kka*]m in Mēyāṟu-nāḍuand refers to a [ka]ṉṉāḍu evidently erected in memory ofthe hero, who is represented in relief near the inscriptionwith a bow and arrow in his hands. First two lines of therecord are published in South Indian Inscriptions, Vol. I,No. 125.
208
Placement
Fifth stone set up in the same place
Year
Chōḷa
King
Parakēsarivarman alias Uḍaiyār Rājēn-dradēva.
Date
5th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Tirumagaḷ-virumba, etc. Recordsa gift of land by a certain Appaṉ Kaṟpakam alias Śōḻa[chūḷā]-maṇi-Viḻupparaiyaṉ, after purchase from the assembly(ūr) of Gaṅgamāttāṇḍapuram in Miyaṟai-nāḍu, a subdivisionof Adhirājēndra-vaḷanāḍu in Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam, forworship, flowers and lamps to the god Sōmīśvaramuḍaiya-Mahādēva and also for worship in the temple of Durgā in thevillage. The earlier portion of this inscription is publishedin South Indian Inscriptions, Vol. I, No. 127.

Remarks

TIRUKKOYILUR TALUK
225
Placement
Tirunāmanallūr.--North wall of themaṇḍapa in front of the centralshrine, Bhaktajanēśvara temple.
Year
Do.
King
Parakēsarivarman alias Rājēndra-chōḷadēva.
Date
6th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Commences with the introduction Tirumaṉṉi-vaḷara, etc.Records a grant of land by the nagarattār ofTirunāvalūr alias Rājādittadēvapuram, a city in Tirumuṉaip-pāḍi Mēlūr-nāḍu, a subdivision of Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍa-lam, for offerings to the images of Sūryadēva and Nambiyā-rūraṉār (i.e. Sundaramūrti-Nāyaṉār) in the temple of Tiruttoṇḍīśvaramuḍaiyār. Records also a further grant of land,after purchase from the same assembly, as dēvadāṉa to thesame temple, by Nārakkan Śrī Aranga[ṉ*] Irāmaṉ aliasSēnāpati Rājēndraśōḻa-Brahmamārāyar.
226
Placement
Same wall
Year
Do.
King
Parakēsarivarman
Date
3rd year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records grant of land to five persons (tirumeḻukiḍum-aḍigaḷmār)for cleaning the precincts of the temple of Tiruttoṇḍīśvarat-tāḷvār.
227
Placement
Do.
Year
Do.
King
Parakēsarivarman alias Rājēndra-Chōḷadēva.
Date
6th year (in words)
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Tirumaṉṉi-vaḷara, etc. Recordsa gift by Āyppāḍi Maḻapāḍi, a Vīraśōḻa-aṇukkaṉ of Śellūr,on behalf of Rājēndraśōḻa-Brahmamārāyar, of a bronze vessel,sheep for providing curds daily to the images of ĀḍavalārNambiyārūraṉār and Gaṇapati, and cows for supplying milkfor the bath of the god during the early morning service onSundays. He arranged for further supply of milk and curddaily to the temple in return for the 32 cows and sheep present-ed by different persons.

Do

249
Placement
East wall of the same mahā-maṇḍapa
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śārvari, Tai 10
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
States that the walls and the maṇḍapas in the temple of Toṇḍa-gaḷ-Nayiṉār at Tirunāvalūr had fallen, that worship in ithad also been in abeyance, and that Śidāṟuḍaiyār Śēdirāyarrepresented the matter to his lord Tiruvēṅgaḍanādar Toṇḍai-māṉ who is given the titles, ‘Pagaittavargaḷ-kālaṉ’ ‘Gaṇḍa-Nārāyaṇaṉ’ and ‘Tiruppaḍi-Vēḷaikkāṟaṉ’ and with thelatter's permission and for his welfare, made a gift of land,for reviving worship along with the services Pagaittavarkālaṉ-śandi and Śidāṟuḍaiyāṉ-śandi.
250
Placement
Same wall
Year
Sāḷuva
King
Narasiṅgadēva Mahārāja
Date
Vikriti, Mārgaḻi 16
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
States that the temple of Toṇḍagaḷ-Nayiṉār at Tirunāvalūr,an independent village in Karuma[v*]ūr-paṟṟu, situated inVaḷudilampaṭṭu-śāvaḍi, had become desolate for some yearswith the maṇḍapas and gōpuras fallen and that Annamaraśar,the avasaram officer of the king, repaired them and afterrehabilitating the village, made a gift of certain taxes accruingtherefrom for reviving worship in the temple, for the meritof the king. (See A.R. Nos. 111 and 213 of 1934-35). The orderregarding this gift was communicated to the trustees of thetemple.
251
Placement
South side of the verandah round thecentral shrine.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śukla, Āvaṇi 10
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 16th century A.D. Records sale ofthe tirumeykāval right in the temple of Toṇḍargaḷ-Nayiṉārat Tirunāvalūr by the trustees to Tirumalaikkoḻundar aliasĀlakālasaundara Vāṇavadaraiyar, son of VāṇavadaraiyarŚellapperumāḷ.
252
Placement
Same side
Year
Pāṇḍya
King
Vikrama-Pāṇḍyadēva
Date
2nd year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Commences with the introduction Samasta-bhuvanaikarīraetc. Records a royal gift of the village O1gūr in Śēndamaṅgalappaṟṟu, made free of taxes, as tirunāmattukkāṇi forofferings during the service called Ulagamuḻuduḍaiyār-śandiin the temple.

266
Placement
Do.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Achyutadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 145[7], Man-matha, Dhanus,śu. [8] Thursday,Uttiraṭṭādi.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Stones lost in the middle. Seems to record the assignment ofthe income of 50 poṉ due from the village Mēṭṭu-Urattūr asumbaḷi-poṉ to Pāpparāja and seven others for carrying thetaṇḍigai (palanquin) and umbrella, evidently of the god atTirunāvalūr. Also records a gift of 1 mā of land at Mēṭṭu-Urattūr by the beneficiaries to Meññāna-māmuni, the discipleof Śīkāḻivaḷḷal-Paṇḍāram, for the benefit of the maṭha atTirunāvalūr. Mentions Salakarāja Tiru[malai]dēva-Mahārājaand Tipparājar Bhōgaiyar belonging to the family ofUṟaiyūr Chōḷas.

284
Placement
Māmbākkam Pullūr.--Stone set up be-hind the Ādikēśava-Perumāḷ temple.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Veṅkaṭapati-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 15[11], Virōdhi,Paṅguṉi 5, śu,Monday, Saptamī.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

Seems to record thegift of the village, Māmbākkam, for offerings in a temple(name lost) at Vṛiddhāchalam by Koṇḍama-Nāyakkar-Ayyaṉ, son of Kṛishṇappayya-Nāyakkar-ayyaṉ.

302

…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Tamil (verse)
Remarks
The characters are of about the 16th century A.D. A versein praise of Guṇabaddira-Muṉivaṉ, evidently a Jaina saintwho was famous in the southern land as a great scholar bothin Tamil and in Sanskrit and who was a native of Koṇḍai-malai.
303

…

Śaka 1283, Śubhakṛit,Dhanus, śu. 13,Wednesday, Kārt-tigai.
Language and Script
Tamil (verse)
Remarks
Records a gift of land for a perpetual lamp in the temple ofAppāṇ[ḍār] by a person (name lost), son of Śembādi Villa-vadaraiyaṉ of Paḻampaṭṭiṇam in Pattiṉa-nāḍu, a subdivisionof Śembūr-kōṭṭam in Jayaṅkoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam. Tirunaruṅ-goṇḍai is said to have formed part of Ādanūr in [Kuru]kkai-kūṟṟam in Tirumuṉaippāḍi-nāḍu, a subdivision of Naḍuvil-maṇḍalam. Mentions Gōppaṇṇa-Uḍaiyar as being instru-mental for this gift. On the same wall is a short inscriptionin characters of about the 16th century A.D. mentioningGuṇabhadrāchārya, called also Vīrasaṅghapratishṭhāchāryan.

CHINGLEPUT DISTRICT SRIPERUMBUDUR TALUK

Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

CONJEEVARAM TALUK
343
Placement
Conjeevaram.--Slab built into the wallof the outermost prākāra of theE1kāmranätha temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
The writing is of the 13th century A.D. States thatthe Īśānadēvar-maḍam was the gift of Periyanāṭṭār. Onthe top of the slab is engraved a human figure seated ona pedestal holding a lotus stalk in either hand. To its rightis a long-necked pitcher (?) and to its left a triangular object.Below the pedestal is an ornamental kumbha with a lampon either side.

…
Date
Śaka 1485,Rudhirōdgāri, Kār-ttika 6, pañchami,Friday, Pushya.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the allotment of lands at Pāṟaipūṭṭai for the severalrequirments of the temple by Vaḍamalai Nāyakar, theofficer (maṇiyakāṟaṉ) under Basavappa-Nāyaka, the agentof Aḷiya-Rāmappaiyyadēva-Mahārājayya, for the meritof the latter two, and the fixation of the extent of landsheld as tenants by the several temple craftsmen and artisansin the dēvadāṉa village Śāttambākkam.
358
Placement

Year
Vijayanagara
King
Śrīraṅgarāyadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 156[1], [Pra-mādi], Kārttika,ba. 15.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Records the gift of a village (name not clear) as sarvamānyato god Mukkaṇṭīśvara at Kalavaguṇṭa by Daḷavāyi Tipā-Nāyanayya.

Date

Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Fragments in characters of about the 10th century A.D.One of them gives the 10th year of a king whose name is lostand seems to record a gift of land to the temple for a per-petual lamp.
367
Placement
Two other stones built into the samewalls.
Year
Chōḷa
King
...... ‘who took Madura’
Date
40th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Fragmentary. This evidently belongs to Parāntaka I.Mentions a wall starting from Viraikkōṭṭai and refers toŚāttamaṅgalam in Muḻaiyūr-nāḍu. A third stone nearthese contains a fragmentary record in the same characters,and records a provision made for offerings and worshipto the deity. Mentions a grain measure called Śōḻagam.

Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1806, Pārthiva,Chittirai 1.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
States that the Garuḍaśērvai-maṇḍapa was built by Tītta-Śeṭṭiyār, son of Tiruvaṁbala-Śeṭṭiyār of the Sāttandai-gōtra, one of the Nagarattār (merchants) living in Pudu-pēṭṭai near Salem.
369
Placement
Three slabs lying on the bund of the tankby the road side.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
The inscriptions on two of the slabs are complete ones and aredated, one in Vikṛiti, Aṟpaśi and the other in Ānanda, Āṉi, 30,and are both modern. The former refers to a gift by oneĀdimūla-Śeṭṭi and the latter to the setting up of a Vināyakaimage by one Śeṅgaḻani-Mudaliyār, son of KāvāṇḍaiMudaliyār.

Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

Thesewere also responsible for the payment of interest in paddyto the temple for the 33 and odd kaḻañju of gold (receivedby them).

…
Date

Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 17th century A.D. Mentions Jagadēvarāya as wielding sway overKuṉṟattūr-durgam and a number of other petty officers orchieftains of Pūndurai-nāḍu, Paruttippaḷḷināḍu and Rāśi-pura-nāḍu.

379
Placement
Inner wall of the outermost gōpura in thesame temple, left of entrance.
Year
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman, alias Tribh. Kula-śēkharadēva, ‘who was pleased totake all countries’.
Date

Tamil

381
Placement
Do.
Year
…
King
Tribh. Kōṉēriṉmaikoṇḍāṉ
Date
39th year, 229th day.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records a royal gift of 20 mā of land at Śōḻakulanallūr, a hamletof Jagadēkavīra-chaturvēdimaṅgalam for worship andofferings to the images of Śellapiḷḷaiyār and Iḷaiyanāyaṉārconsecrated in the name of the king's father in the garden-land attached to the royal palace at Vīradāvaḷam. Theland after being entered into the tax remission accountswas added to the dēvadāṉa of the Viḻumiya-Nāyaṉār temple.The record is signed at the end by Ponnāṇḍāṉ Pallavarāyaṉof Tuñjalūr in Miḻalai-kūṟṟam.

387
Placement
Do.
Year
Chōḷa
King
Rājakēsarivarman alias Chak-ravartin Kulōttuṅgaśōḻadēva.
Date
3[0]th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

388
Placement
Do.
Year
…
King
Tribh. Kōnērimaikoṇḍāṉ
Date
24th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Much damaged. Seems to record the formation of a newcolony of merchants after acquiring lands and house-sitesfor the purpose in the village, under the name Koṅgu[koṇḍa]-śōḻapuram, by order of the king, at the request of Toṇḍaimānfixing the annual revenue payable to the State thereon at23,000 kalam of paddy on cultivable lands and 1000 kāśuon dry lands (by the inhabitants). Quotes the 14th yearof Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷadēva, ‘who abolished the tolls’.
389
Placement
Same wall, right of entrance
Year
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Rājarājadēva
Date
26+1st year, Risha-bha, ba. 11, Wed-nesday, Rēvatī.

Tamil

390
Placement
Pēṭṭaivāyttalai.--South wall of maṇ-ḍapa in front of central shrine Madhyār-juna temple.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Dēvarāya [Mahārā]ya, son of VīraVijayarāya-Mahārāya.
Date
Śaka 1 *** Kīlaka,Mithuna, ba. 10,Monday, Aśvati.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Built in at the ends of lines and incomplete. Seems torecord there-consecration of two temples, viz., of Avanīśvaraand Tiruvakkīśvara, while renovating the temple of Madu-rāntīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār at Rājēndraśōḻa-pēṭṭai inŚūralūr-kūṟṟam, a subdivision of Rājagaṁbhīra-vaḷanāḍu,by the nagarattār of the place, who also made provision forworship in them.
391
Placement
Peruṅguḍi.--North wall of the centralshrine, Agastyēśvara temple.

Pāṇḍya
King

MALABAR DISTRICT PALGHAT TALUK
402
Placement
Peruvamba.--Slab set up in the pre-cincts of the ruined temple of Nandīś-vara.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Vaṭṭeḻuttu
Remarks
Highly damaged. The writing may be assigned to about the11th century A.D. Mentions some cheṭṭis and [Padi]-neṇbhūmi Tiśaiy-Āyirattaiññūṟṟu[var] communities andthe Vaḷañjiyar.

List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1940-41.


NORTH ARCOT DISTRICT WALAJAPET TALUK
1
Placement
Kaṇiyanūr.--Slab lying near the Vīra-rāghava-Perumāḷ temple.
Year
Chōḷa
King
Parakēsarivarman alias Rājēndra-Chōḷadēva.
Date
24th year (in words)
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Beginning lost. Gives a portion of the historical introductioncommencing with the words, Tirumaṉṉi-vaḷara, etc. Recordsa gift of land, made tax free for a perpetual lamp in the templeof Aṇigōva-Viṇṇagarāḻvār by the assembly of Vīradivākara-chaturvēdimaṅgalam situated in Peruntimiri-nāḍu, a sub-division of Paḍuvūr-kōṭṭam in Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam.
2
Placement
Proper right door-jamb of entrance intothe Aṇigōpanāthēśvara temple.
Year
Do.
King
Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷa
Date
27th year (in words)
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Incomplete. Mentions Kaṇikainallūr alias Vīradivākara-chaturvēdimaṅgalam, a brahmadēya in Peruntimiri-nāḍu,a subdivision of Paḍuvūr-kōṭṭam.
3

Year
…
King
…
Date
13th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

4
Placement
Boulder in a field (S. No. 447) to the southof the village.
Year
Chōḷa
King
Rājarājakēsarivarman
Date
17th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Tirumagaḷpōla, etc. Recordsthe sale of 400 kuḻi of land as kuśakkāṇi to a certain potterof the village, by the assembly of Kaṇiñallūr in Peruntimiri-nāḍu.
5
Placement
Pudūr, hamlet of Kaṇiyaṉūr.--Boulderin Survey No. 107 near the south bundof the Nettapākkaṁ lake.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1558, Śōbha-kṛit, Chittirai 29.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records purchase of land in Agaram Kaṇiyaṉūr for the lakeat Agaram Veḷḷambai and refers to the construction of achannel, evidently in the same land.

…
Date
…
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

7
Placement
Puṅgaṉūr.--North wall of the desertedŚiva temple.
Year
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Kulōttuṅga-Chōḷa
Date
16th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
States that on the representation of the villagers that Puṅ-gaṉūr and its hamlets were without a blacksmith, Vēḍaip-perumāḷ alias Vikramaśōḻa-Śambuvarāyaṉ appointedTēttāṉ, a blacksmith of Śembai, to serve in the locality.

Year
Do.
King
Rājarājakēsarivarman

9
Placement
West wall of the same temple
Year
Do.
King
Rājakēsarivarman, ‘who destroyedships at Kāndaḷūr-śālai.’
Date
11th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records a gift of land, after purchase, as taragubhōga by Poṉṉ-ayaṉ, son of Tiruvārūr-aḍigaḷ, the headman of Aṉiyūr inAṉiyūr-nāḍu, a subdivision of Veṇkuṉṟa-kōṭṭam for providingwater during summer and firewood during winter in thehall called Vīraśōḻaṉ constructed by him at Puṅgaṉūr inPeruntimiri-nāḍu.

…
Date

Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

11
Placement
South wall of the same temple
Year
Chōḷa
King
Rājarājakēsarivarman, ‘who destroyedships at Kāndaḷūr-śālai’.
Date
11th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records gift of land, after purchase, from the assembly (ūr)of Puṅgaṉūr, to the temple by the same Poṉṉayaṉ. Theassembly also undertook to maintain a lamp in thetemple in lieu of the interest on the money received bythem from Poṉṉayaṉ.

Language and Script

Placement
Pillar in the maṇḍapa in front of thecentral shrine in the same temple.
Year
Do.
King
Parakēsarivarman, ‘who took Maduraand Īḻam’.
Date
41st year (in words)
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

Year
Do.
King
Rājēndradēva
Date
2nd year (in words)
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Beginning lost. Gives a portion of the historicalintroduction of the king beginning with the words Tirumagaḷ-maruviya, etc. Seems to record an agreement byKarumāṇikka Ammai-appaṉ alias Śōḻakulasundara-Āchāri-yaṉ who had the tachchakkāṇi of the village Śōḻakula-sundari-chaturvēdimaṅgalam, to supply an uḻakku of gheeevery day for a perpetual lamp in the temple.
20
Placement

Year
Do.
King
Rājakēsarivarman alias UḍaiyārRājādhirājadēva.
Date
34th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Tiṅgalēr-peṟa, etc. Recordsthe remission of the taxes iṛai and antarāyam on a pieceof land endowed after purchase as vyākaraṇa-bhaṭṭavṛittiby (the temple of) Rājarājaviṇṇagar-Āḻvār in Śōḻakula-sundari-chaturvēdimaṅgalam in Mēlmalai Ogaivalla-nāḍu,a subdivision of Jayaṅgoṇḍaśōḻa-maṇḍalam by the mahā-sabhā of the village, in consideration of a lump-sum of 20kāśu received by them from the temple. Mentions SēnāpatiArumoḻi-Vikramaśōḻaṉ alias Rājādhirāja-Mahābalivāṇa-rāyar on whose initiative the endowment was made.

24
Placement
Śakkaramallūr.--North wall of thecentral shrine in the Tirukkaṇḍīśvaratemple.
Year
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Rājarājadēva
Date
15th year (in words),Makara, śu. 13,Saturday, Punar-pūśam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records an endowment of 500 kuḻi of land for the early morningservice in the temple of Mukkaṇṇadēvar at Chakramūdūr,an independent village in Dāmar-kōṭṭam of Jayaṅgoṇḍa-śōḻa-maṇḍalam, made by order of the king through the agencyof Piḷḷaiyār Madhurāntakap-Pottappichchōḻar alias Gaṇḍa-gōpāla, by Dāmōdaraṉ Aruḷālapperumāḷ, the headman ofSōmaṅgalam in Maṅgala-nāḍu, a subdivision of Tirumuṉap-pāḍi-nāḍu in Rājarāja-vaḷanāḍu.

Remarks

29
Placement
West wall of the same shrine.
Year
Chōḷa
King
Do
Date
14th (?) year, Vṛiś-chika, śu. 6, Sun-day, Uttirāḍam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
An agreement by the Śivabrāhmaṇas to burn a perpetuallamp before the god in return for 600 kāśu endowed by Peri-yanāchchi alias Periyanāṭṭunaṅgai, a dēvaraḍiyāḷ of thetemple, and the bestowal by the sthānattār on her and herdescendants the right of owning the first house in the tiru-maḍaiviḷāgam and of precedence of honour on festival occasionsin the temple in consideration of another gift of 500 kāśumade by her.
30
Placement
West and south walls of the same shrine.
Year
Do.
King
Rājakēsarivarman alias Tribh. Vikra-ma-Chōḷadēva.
Date
7th year (in words)
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Pūmādu puṇara, etc. Givesa detailed list of the lands with their extent specified ineach case, which had been endowed to the temple for itsvarious requirements and recorded on its wall prior to itsrenovation by Tiruchchiṟṟambalamuḍaiyāṉ Tirunāgai-dēvaṉ alias Śembiyaṉ-Mūvēndavēḷāṉ of Ālattūr in Ālattūr-nāḍu, a subdivision of Nittavinōda-vaḷanāḍu in Śōḻa-maṇḍa-lam and which were now confirmed by the ūrār of the place.A few donors of the lands mentioned in the list also figureas signatories at the end of the record.
31
Placement
Do.
Year
Do.
King
Do.
Date
Do.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift of lands in Naralōkavīranallūr measuring13500 kuḻi in extent as dēvadāṉa to god Mukkaṇdēvar bythe ūrār of the village so as to provide for expenses offestivals in the temple with the vēlikkāśu, veṭṭimuṭṭaiyāḷand other taxes accruing therefrom. All the signatoriesof the previous inscription figure in this record also.

Year

Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

35
Placement
Do.
Year
…
King
Tribh. Allun-Tirukkāḷattidēva Gaṇḍa-gōpāla.
Date
6th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
States that the circuit round the temple was built of stoneby Sūrappa-Nāyaka of Viṇṇamalai in Mēlaippaṭṭai-nāḍu,a chieftain under Tyāgasamudrappaṭṭai Vīmaraśar, whoalso made a gift of all the (āyam) income (due to him)from the dēvadāna (lands) of the temple and of the taxeson looms working in the tirumaḍaiviḷāgam area and also of thefee in oil realised from the oil-presses in the village, for thesacred cloth and other requirements of the god and forburning 4 twilight lamps in the temple.

…
Date

Language and Script
Tamil (verse)
Remarks
In characters of about the 13th century A.D. Praises theliberality of Siddhinātha alias Śaivaśēkarappiratā-paṉ, a resident of Mandiradara, who is said to have suppliedthe people of Chakrapurī with abundance of rice during asevere famine.

Placement
Slab set up in a street
Year
Chōḷa
King

Tamil
Remarks

POLUR TALUK
44
Placement
Paḍavēḍu.--South wall of the centralshrine in the Rēṇukāmbā temple.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Narasiṅga-r[ā*]ya Uḍaiyar.
Date
Śaka 1394, Dur-mukhi, Vaigāśi 2.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Order of Pradhāna-Nayiṉār of Paḍaivīḍu, the agent of the king,treating as mānya, the fees received in the temple of Ekkalā-dēvi-Ammaṉ on ordinary days and on festival occasions.
45
Placement
East wall (inside) of the mahā-maṇḍapain the same temple.
Year
Do.
King
Śrīraṅgadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1484 (wrongfor 1488), Akshaya,Āḍi.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Order of Iḍaittuṟai Tambikkōṉ and Kāvanāyakakkōṉ, theagents of China-Bommu-Nāyakarayyaṉ of Vēlūr, appointingfour persons as Tiruviḷakkuk-kuḍi for the annual supply of atūṇi of ghee for burning lamps and for the sacred bath ofgoddess Prasanna Ekkalādēvi-Ammai of Marudaraśar-Paḍaivīḍu on the days of Tiruvādirai and of four sheep eachday on the days of Mahānavamī and Paṅguṉi-Uttiram(evidently for sacrifice), in lieu of certain taxes they had topay in Kalavai.

Placement
Wall near the western entrance into thesame temple.
Year
Do.

Tamil
Remarks
Appointment of two persons as the tiruviḷakkuk-kuḍi for (thetemple of) Sōmanāthadēva-Nayiṉār at Paḍaivīḍu.

50
Placement
Side of rock below Vaḷḷimalai (hill), afew furlongs to the north of the sametemple.

Vijayanagara
King
Vīra-Viruppaṇa-Uḍaiyar, son ofAriyappa-Uḍaiyar.
Date
Kshaya
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Gift (by king, of land) to the east of the irrigation channelflowing from the anicut, as dēvadāna to the temple of Virū-pākshadēva.

The appointees were to pay 24 paṇam a year inmonthly instalments and were exempted from the śammādamand kāṇikkai taxes.

Tamil
Remarks
Appointment of a shepherd (name lost), as the tiruviḷakkuk-kuḍi(for supplying oil or ghee for lamps) to the temple of Pēraruḻ-āḷa-Perumāḷ at Śambuvarāyanallūr, by ŚūrappavēlāṉKoṅgarāyaṉ-Periyāvaṉ who was responsible with others forthe (payment of) śādam to Murugamaṅgalappaṟṟu.
101
Placement
Śēdarampaṭṭu.--Side of rock known as‘karuvēṭṭuppāṟai’ to the east of the rail-way bridge.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Īśvara, Mārgaḻi 8
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the settlement made by Nañjana-Uḍaiyar fixing theflow of water through the channel, Ariyappaṉ-kāl, from thetank at Kāmakkanallūr for one day in eight for irrigatingcertain lands at Śambuvarāyanallūr.
102
Placement
Same rock
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
States that the water flowing through the Ariyappaṉ-kāl(channel) is not to be dammed within the limits of Śambu-varāyanallūr (for purposes of storage and irrigation).
103
Placement
Rock near the left bank of the Paḍaivīḍuriver to the west of the railway bridge.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
States that the canal newly dug from the tank at Śēḻiya-daraiyaṉpaṭṭu was, after irrigating lands in the village, to belet in into the tank at Kāmakkanallūr and then continuedtherefrom into the village Śambuvarāyanallūr (for irrigation).
TIRUVANNAMALAI TALUK
104
Placement
Malayaṉūr.--Hero-stone set up on theright bank of the Pāmbanāṟu (stream).
Year
Chōḷa
King
Rājakēsarivarman
Date
20th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 9th century A.D. States that thisrepresents Vāṇagō-Veṭṭuvadi-araiyagaḷ. The inscription isengraved above the figure of a warrior with a sword in theright hand and a bow in the left.
105
Placement
Another hero-stone set up in the sameplace.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 9th century A.D. This is alsoengraved above the figure of a warrior holding a sword byhis right hand and bow by his left. Refers to a cattle-raidin which a certain Nandikuṭṭi seems to have lost his life.
106
Placement
A third hero-stone set up in the sameplace.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
In similar characters. Fragment. Mentions a certainNandikuṭṭi, son of Mīnagarkāḷi and Malaiyaṉūr in Mīkoṉṟai-nāḍu which he was probably administering.
107
Placement
Aṟaḍāppaṭṭu.--Lintel over the entranceinto the maṇḍapa of the dilapidatedŚiva temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Khara, Āṉi 18
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
In characters of about the 14th century A.D. Records theperpetual devotion (to god), of Vīrappaṉ, the Kaḍaikkūṭṭu ofVāṇādarāya-Paṇḍāram. Perhaps the gift of this beam wasmade by the person named above.
108
Placement
West wall, right of entrance, of the frontgōpura of the same temple.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 147[9], Piṅgala,Mārgaḻi 25, śu. 12,Monday, Rēvatī.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Left unfinished. Seems to record an endowment of land forthe daily worship and festivals of (god) Viśvanātha-Nayiṉārat Ariyaluḍaiyā[r*]paṭṭu in Vāṇagōppāḍi-nāḍu, a dēva-maṇḍalam of god Aṇṇāmalaiyār (Aruṇāchalēśvara atTiruvaṇṇāmalai) by Viśvanātha-Nayiṉār.

Placement

Year
Do.
King
Do
Date

Tamil

CHINGLEPUT DISTRICT SAIDAPET TALUK
110
Placement
Paḻavantāṅgal.--On a stone set up inthe village.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Achyutarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1452, Vikṛiti,Dakshiṇāyana,Vṛiśchika, śu.Paurṇamī, Friday,Kṛittikā.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. Records the grant of the villages Gaṅgainallūrand Paḻavantāṅgal as dēvadāṉa to the temple of Subrahmaṇyacalled Seruvidi-Nayiṇār at Kōyampēḍu for the merit of theking by Mahāpradhāna Śellappa Sāḷuva-Daṇṇāyaka ofKāñchīpuram. Nearby is another slab containing a highlydamaged inscription of the same king which seems also torecord the gift of a village (name not clear) to the sametemple.
111
Placement
Vaḷaśaravākkam.--West wall of theruined Śiva temple on the roadside.
Year
Chōḷa
King
Tribh. Vīrarājēndradēva
Date
4th year, Siṁha, śu.11, Punarpūśam,Sunday.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
An agreement by the Śivabrāhmaṇa Mahāvrati KāśyapaṉTaḻuvakkuḻaindān-Paṇḍitaṉ Iḍarnīkki-Bhaṭṭaṉ to burn atwilight lamp in the temple of Tiruvēḷvīśuramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār at Vaḷḷiśērpākkam in Mēlūr-nāḍu for 1(1/2) Gaṇḍa-gōpālaṉ-pudumāḍai received by him from a lady, the wife ofanother Śivabrāhmaṇa of a temple at Kommaipākkam.

.... Tulā, śu. 5,Sunday, Mūla.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records a similar royal order issued to the tānattār of thetemple making a tax-free gift of the village Vaṇṇāttūr in theproportion of three shares to one for the expenses of a festivalcalled after prince Sundara-Pāṇḍya and of a service in thename of the king and for the worship of the images of Vīra-pāṇḍīśvaramuḍaiya-Nāyaṉār and Dēśamikka-Perumāṇāch-chiyār consecrated by the same prince in the templeSundara-Pāṇḍya is called in the inscriptions Ubhaiyadaḷa-kumāraśārdūla.

Vijayanagara

Remarks

171
Placement
Same wall
Year
…
King
…
Date
Plava, Māśi, 10
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records an assurance given on oath on Svāmi Īśura-Nāyakkarby Tippaya-Nāyakkar, to the Nāṭṭavar of Magadai-maṇḍalamthat he would not levy any taxes from them beyond therates specified in the aḍai-ōlai executed by him nor disturbany household (as a consequence). This assurance was theresult of a representation made by the nāṭṭavar that theirfamilies were broken up on account of several hardshipssuffered by them.

207
Placement
Śendurai.--West wall of the Śiva temple
Year
Chōḷa
King
Rājakēsarivarman, ‘who destroyed theships at Kāndaḷur-śālai’.
Date
1[9]th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Incomplete. Records a gift of land after purchasing it fromthe sabhā of Śendurai by a certain [Teṉ]ṉaṉ Pāttirāśēkharaṉto the temple of Śendurai-Mahādēva for the conduct of afestival in the asterism Viśākhā in the Vaigāśi month.Śendurai is stated to have been a dēvadāṉa-brahmadēyasituated in Tuṇḍanāḍu.

RAMNAD DISTRICT SRIVILLIPUTTUR TALUK
230
Placement
Śēttūr.--North wall of the central shrinein the Sulōchanēśvara temple.
Year
Do.
King
Dharmapperumāḷ Kulaśēkharadēva
Date
Śaka 1483, 13th year,Durmati,DakshiṇāyanaMēshaṛitu, Kaṉṉi-Ravi 19, śu. 10,Thursday, Utti-rāḍam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
An order purporting to have been issued by god Dṛishṭīśvararatifying the appointment made by prince Aḻagan PerumāḷAtivīrarāma of Ūruḍaiya-Mudali alias Vīrapāṇḍ[ya*]nśūḍikkoḍutta-Mudali of the temple of Tiruvālavāyuḍaiyārat Māḍakkuḷakkīḻmadurai as the accountant of this temple,with the remuneration pertaining to the post specified.Śēṟṟūr is stated to be situated in Āṇmaṟai-nāḍu.

Placement
Same wall
Year
Do.
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Vikrama-Pāṇḍyadēva.
Date
5+1st year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

West wall of the same shrine.
Year
Do.

Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Kulaśēkhara-dēva.
Date

Language and Script

235
Placement
North wall of the central shrine in theŚrīnivāsa-Perumāḷ temple.
Year
Do.
King
Jaṭāvarman Tribh. Kulaśēkharadēva.
Date
13th year, 3356thday.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Pūviṉkiḻatti, etc. Recordsa royal order granting the village Tiruvaraṅganēri, tax-free, for the expenses of worship and offerings in the templeof Śēranārāyaṇa Viṇṇagar Āḻvār built by Viradamuḍitta-Perumāḷ. The village was left in charge of the nagarak-kaṇakku by name Pulivalamuḍaiyāṉ and his descendantsas tenants.
236
Placement
South wall of the same shrine
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
Do.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Do. Records another gift of half a vēli of land to the templeby the king at the request of his brother-in-law Virada-muḍitta-Perumāḷ (mentioned above). The king is said tohave been seated on his throne (Paḷḷippīḍam), Maḻavarāyaṉ,in his palace at Madura, east of Māḍakkuḷam in Madurōdaya-vaḷanāḍu. Mentions Mantri Rāmaṉ alias Pallavarājaṉof Perumaṇalūr in Aṇḍa-nāḍu.
237
Placement
Stones built irregularly into the walls ofthe same shrine.
Year
Pāṇḍya
King
Jaṭāvarman alias Tribh. Kulaśēkhara-dēva.
Date
13+12th year (inwords).
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

243
Placement
Same wall
Year
Do.
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Śrīval-labhadēva.
Date
31st year (in words),Kumbha 26, śu. 1,Friday, Pūraṭṭādi.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records an order of the king issued from his office room(eḻuttu-maṇḍapa) at Varatu[ṅga*]dēvanallūr in Āriya-nāḍu granting the village Toṇḍaṉkuḷam for the expenses ofthe service called Āhavarāmaṉ-śandi instituted by the kingin the temple, of festivals and of the sacred bath on ashṭamīdays in the dark fortnights. Pūraṭṭādi is stated to be thenatal star of the king. Refers to some previous gifts madeby the king in his 28+2nd year and by Nāyaṉār Parākrama-Pāṇḍyadēva. Refers also to a donation made for conductingParākrama-Pāṉdyaṉ-śandi.

Tamil
Remarks
Built in in the middle by the Dakshiṇāmūrti shrine. Seems torecord an order of the king issued from his palace at Kaṇṇaṉūr,remitting the taxes on some lands endowed to the templeby the nagarattār of Pūḷam.
258
Placement
Do.
Year
Do.
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh
Date
32nd year, [2]83rdday], Vai]kāśi.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Built in the middle by the Dakshiṇāmūrti shrine. Recordsan order of the king issued while he was seated on the thronecalled Tiruvāṉaikkā-Uḍaiyaṉ in his palace at Vīradhāvaḷamremitting taxes on several plots of land which had beenendowed to the temple as adhyayana-vṛitti, vīṇai-vṛittitirumēṟpūchchu-puṟam (for unguents) and tirunandāvana-puṟam (for flower garden), etc.

Placement
Same wall
Year
Pāṇḍya
King
Māṟavarman alias Tribh. Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva.

11+3rd year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

Kuṟumbilis said to be a dēvadāṉa village of god Tiruvānandapurattu-dēvar.

Tamil
Remarks
Records the death of a certain Pōvāśi Maḻavarāya-Śiruvaṉ,the Maravaṉ of Kuṇḍaiyaṉkōṭṭai while fighting (his foes)on the occasion of the attack by Veṅgaḷarāja with hisarmy during the sojourn of Tirunelvēlipperumāḷ alias Vēṭ-ṭuṁperumāḷ at Iḷavēlaṅgāl.

316
Placement
East wall of the mukha-maṇḍapa (right ofentrance) in front of the same shrine.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Built in and stones lost. Seems to record sale of lands in avillage in specified shares to several individuals by Dēvēn-dravarman evidently an officer of the king with the permission of Kaṇḍiyadēva, as the original holders had leftthe place without paying the dues thereon. A fragment ofan inscription on the south side close by is dated in the reignof Tribhuvanachakravartin Sundara-Pāṇḍyadēva.

King

Date

Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Fragmentary and worn out. Seems to register the grant oftheir vartanas, by the vipravinōdins for the merit of theirtwenty-four families. The benefit was to go for the mahōtsa-vas (festivals) of some deity. Mentions Jaṁbulamaḍaka.

349
Placement
Garisalūru.--Slab lying near the ruinedtemple of Śiva.
Year
Vijayanagara

Achyutarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1453, Khara,Chaitra, śu. 15
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Registers gift of land made by Narasabhūpāla, son of Tiru-malarāja and Tirumalādēvī and grandson of KaṇṭhamarājaTimmarāja for the benefit of the god Chennakēśava at....on the bank of the Kumudvatī in the Chēṁgalamaṟi-sīmaof Muliki-nāḍu in the Udayagiri-rājya. The donor bears anumber of epithets such as Bejavāḍapuravarādhīśvara,Mādhavavarmakula-pradīpa, Bejavāḍapālapratishṭhāpan-āchārya, etc. He belonged to the solar race and Vaśishṭha-gōtra and is said to be a subordinate of the king. Alsorecords a provision made to the pipers, etc., for service inthe temple.

Telugu
Remarks
Records confirmation of a former grant of the sthaḷa-suṅkamade by the Vidvan-Mahājanas of the village Namilidinneand by Kṛishṇayyaṅgāru, son of Pōlipalle Tipparāju madepreviously by Rāmarāya (of Āravīḍu) for the daśamī-mahōtsavas of the Perumāḷ. The village Namilidinne isstated to be situated in Pōlūri-sīma and given as nāyaṅkarato Bukkarāja-Timmarāja.

Remarks

Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1468, Viśvā-vasu, Vaiśäkha,śu. 5.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Records the grant of the perquisites excluding the Maharāja-prayōjana, etc., that accrued in the form of money, rice,betel, etc., from the village Vēlpucherla in the Chāṁgala-maṟṟi-sīma, the nāyaṅkara of Nallan-Timarājayya,Pāṭḷāvāri-Uppalūru and Varadarājula-Dudyāla in theGhaṇḍikōṭa-sīma, the nāyaṅkara of Nandyāla Timmarā-jayya-Nāraparājayya, by the asaṅkhyātas of the villagesto the goddess Aṁkāḷaparamēśvarī of Vēlpucharla forworship and festivals. Records also gift of daily rationsto the artisan (Vaḍla) Timvōju of Vēlpucherla for havingengraved this inscription.
404
Placement
Slab in survey No. 283, west of the village.
Year
Do.
King
Sadāś vadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1482, Raudri,Āshāḍha, śu. 12.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a grant of some tolls made by MahāmaṇḍalēśvaraKoṇḍarā[jaya]deva-Mahārāja, son of China-Timmayaand grandson of Pedakoṇḍarāja of Āravīḍu for offerings togod Madanagōpālakṛishṇa of Vēlpucherla (probablyinstalled by the chief).

Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks

The village Sukumañchipalle which iscalled a paḍumaṭihōra-grāma is stated to be included inthe Ghaṇḍikōṭa-sīma, held by the donor as nāyaṅkarafrom the king.

440
Placement

Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 13[88], Vyaya,Phālguṇa, ba. 30,solar eclipse.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Records the gift of the village Mēḍikuriti by Mahāmaṇḍalēś-vara Huliya Mallayadēva-Mahārāja for worship of the deitiesNīlakaṇṭhadēva and Goṅgaḍayya of Niṭṭūru, stipulatingthat the net income from the various taxes of the villagebe equally shared between the two temples. The donorbears the titles Gōḍeyarāya, Rūpa-Nārāyaṇa, Rāya-Huli,Rāya-Gaṇḍabhēruṇḍa, etc. The gift was made for the,merit of Narasiṅgarājoḍeya.

In faint characters of about the 14th century A.D. Seemsto mention Śrī Vidyānandasvāmin and Chippagiri.

KISTNA DISTRICT KAIKALUR TALUK

Sanskrit & Telugu
