Records the foundation of certain temples at Kaika-lūru alias Kaiṅkaryapura and gifts of lands made to themand their establishments by Khaṇḍērāya of the Kūḍalgefamily, who was a Mādhva of the Kāṇva-śākhā.

List of stone inscriptions copied during the year 1941-42


VIZAGAPATAM DISTRICT VIZAGAPATAM TALUK
1
Placement
Appikoṇḍa.--A pillar in the Śiva templeon the sea-shore.
Year
Eastern Chāḷukya
King
Sarvalōkāśraya Vishṇuvardhana-Mahārāja Upēndradēva-Chakravarti.
Date
…
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Incomplete. Begins with the Eastern Chāḷukya praśasi,Sakala-bhuvana, etc. Refers to god Sōmēśvara ofAppakonḍa to whom some gifts were madeby the king for the merit of his father Koppayadēva-Chakravarti. The king is mentioned as a devotee of godChillīśvara-Mahādēva.
2
Placement
Another pillar in the same temple
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1053, Chāḷukya-Vikrama year 5[5],Sādhāraṇa, Phāl-guṇa, ba. 11,Wednesday.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Incomplete. Seems to record the confirmation of the exist-ing gift of the dēvabhōga village Appikoṇḍa to godSōmēśvara of Dantivāra by the general Māchimayya-Nāyaka and the Commander Mārtaṇḍayya-Nāyaka. Theformer is stated to be the pradhāna of MahāpradhānaDaṇḍanāyaka Annarāja, who bears several titles, and tobe in charge of (samastādhikāri) Viśākhapaṭṭaṇa in theeast of Paṁpavāḍi.
WEST GODAVARI DISTRICT ELLORE TALUK
3
Placement
Muṇḍūru.--Broken pillar set up on thesluice of the tank called Kannasamud-ram, 1(1/2) miles to the east of the village.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Sanskrit & Telugu prose & verse
Remarks
Fragmentary. Refers to the construction of a tank calledKannasāgara by the chief Mēdinirāya of the Chintalapaṭḷafamily in the name of his mother. A tenth portion ofthe produce under the tank is assigned to the engineerwho built it. In characters of about the 16th century A.D.
KISTNA DISTRICT GANNAVARAM TALUK
4
Placement
Ailūru. (Ayyalūru).--Pillar set up in thecompound of the Vishṇu temple.
Year
Kutbshāhis of Gol-konda.
King
Hajarati Ālaṁpanah Sultān AbdullāKhutupa Śāha.
Date
Śaka 1563, Vṛisha,Jyēshṭha, Śu, 2,Friday.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Registers the grant of the village Madhurāpura as an agrahārato Vēmūri Anantanārāyaṇa-Sarvatōmukhayājī, for havingperformed the sarvatōmukha-yajña, by the local chiefMīr-Jumla Amīr Muhammad Sayyad Nawab at the instanceof Maṅgalagiri-Pantulu. A worn-out inscription on thereverse of the pillar seems to define some land boundaries.
5
Placement
Back side of the Kṛishṇa image in theKaṇigalaṅka in the Kṛishṇā river.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Fasli 124[9]
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Marks the boundary between Kaṇigalaṅka, the hamlet ofAyilūru and Annavaramlaṅka, the hamlet of Annavaram.
6
Placement
Śāyapuram.--Pillar set up in front of theVishṇu temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 150[0] (in words),Tāraṇa, Kārttika,Śaradṛitu, ba. 11,Thursday
Language and Script
Sanskrit & Telugu prose & verse
Remarks
Damaged. Gives the genealogy of the minister Anantaprabhuand records the foundation of an agrahāra named Lakshmī-Nṛisiṁhapura, by him and his wife Timmāmbā.
KAIKALUR TALUK
7
Placement
Gōkarṇapuram (hamlet of Kollēṭikōṭa)--The pānavaṭṭam of the liṅga in thetemple of Gōkarṇēśvara.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1175, Uttarā-yaṇa Saṅkarānti.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Registers gift of money, land and a house-site made by Vāsana-Bōyuṇḍu, son of Malle-Bōyuḍu of Guḍivāḍa and Erakā-sāni, for a perpetual lamp in the temple of Gōkarṇēśvara-Mahādēva of Guḍipūṇḍi. Refers to the measure calledNandimānika.
8

Do.
Year
…
King
…

10
Placement

Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka [1....]
Language and Script
Sanskrit & Telugu
Remarks
Registers a gift of 2 maṟuttus of land made by Chaṁḍubāvi-Amma, the younger sister of Gaṇḍapeṇḍāra Gaṅga[ya]-Sāhiṇi for the daily offerings of god Alāḷanātha of Kāñchchi(Conjeevaram). The Sanskrit portion mentions the Has-tigiri (i.e., the hillock on which the god Varadarāja ofConjeevaram is installed).
11
Placement
Slab lying in front of a private house, nowremoved into the Chennakēśava temple.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka.. Vi[bhava],Magha, śu. 15.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Fragmentary and worn out. Records the remission of taxesdue by barbers (maṅgalipannu) such as vetti-vēmulu, etc.
12
Placement
Slab set up near a field close to the Chan-dravaṅka stream on the way to the tem-ple of Chintala-Rāmaliṅgēśvara.
Year
…
King
…
Date
[Śaka] 1719, Kīlaka,
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Refers to the consecration of thegod Chintala Rāmēśvarasvāmin and the goddess Bāla-Tripurasundarī and registers an endowment of money madefor their daily worship and offerings. The name of thedonor who belonged to the Harita-gōtra is lost.
13
Placement
A broken Nandi-pillar lying in the com-pound of the same temple.
Year
Kākatīya
King
Rudradēva-Mahārāja
Date
Śaka 1210, Sarva-dhārin, [Vaiśā-kha], śu. 15, Thurs-day.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a gift of land made by Mallikārjuna-Nāyaka theson of Bōl-Nāyuḍu and a subordinate of the king, to godRāmanāthadēva of Mahādēvicherla in Pallināḍu 300, in thepresence of god Mallināthadēva of Śrīparvata.
14
Placement
Sculptured stone lying behind the sametemple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Much damaged. Mentions Bētarāju. The sculpture depietsan armed warrior riding a caparisoned horse. In charactersof about the 13th century A.D.
15
Placement
Slab set up in the field of MahaboobSahib, teacher in the local GovernmentSchool.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Kṛishṇadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1448, Vyaya,Kārttika, śu. 2,[Sunday].
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Records the grant of land at Mācherla in the Nāgārjunakoṇḍa-sīma made by Kōnapa-Nāyuḍu, son of Koṇḍa Kūnapu-Nāyuḍu, the kāryakartta of ‘Triyaṁbakarusayya’ who wasthe governor of Koṇḍavīḍu, for the daily offerings, vegetablesand flowers, to the temples of the gods Ishṭa-Kāmēśvaraand Vīrēśvara (of the place).
16
Placement
Broken slab kept in the compound ofthe taluk office.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1056, (in chro-nogram), Ānanda,Pushya, ba. 15,solar eclipse.
Language and Script
Sanskrit & Telugu
Remarks
Fragmentary. Registers the gift by Anuṁguṁ-Gāmabhū-pati of the village Koppunūru in Pallināḍu-300 to the godKāḍēśvara, consecrated by Trilōchana-Pallava at the city ofMahādēvītaṭāka, at the instance of Mahāmāhe4śvara Mallika,son of Kēśava, for daily offerings.
17
Placement
Another broken slab lying in the sameplace.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1710, Kīlaka,Phālguṇa, śu. 15.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Records the endowment of an annuity of 25 varāhas, for thedaily worship and offerings of the god Rāmaliṅgēśvara andthe goddess Bālā-Tripurasundarī on the banks of the riverChandrabhāgā, made by Nāgulapāṭi Appāji-Pantulu, sonof Veṅkanna-Pantulu and grandson of Mṛityuñjaya-Dīkshi-ita. The annuity was met by the tolls collected in thedifferent villages of the 5 pargaṇās and the endowmentmade with the consent of the Dēśamukhs and Dēśapāṇḍesof the pargaṇās (See No. 13 above which is a copy of thepresent record).
18
Placement
Broken slab found near the well about 2miles from Mācherla on the way to Kam-bhaṁpāḍu.
Year
Eastern Chāḷukya
King
Sakalalōkāśraya Jayasiṁhavallabha (II)
Date
8th year
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Slightly damaged. Registers a grant of land made by Kalyā-ṇavasantulu, the son (?) (muṭḷu) of Dhanyavasanta-Pṛithivī-Dēśaraṭṭaguḍi, who was the son (?) (muṭḷu) of Dayāvasanta-Pṛithivī-Dēśaraṭṭaguḍi, to Arahanta-Bhaṭāra. The giftwas to be maintained by the family of Raṭṭaguḍis of Koṁ-thūru.

Year
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1469, Parābha-va, Chaitra, śu. 11,Monday.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Records the remission of the tax on the barbers in the villagesin Ghaṇḍikōṭa-sīma by Nandyāla Timmarājayya conse-quent on similar remission, made on the barbers of theempire by the order of the king, at the request of Koṇḍōju,son of Timmōju.
29
Placement
Another slab lying in the same place
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
Śaka 1471, Kīlaka,Āshāḍha, śu. 11.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Registers the grant by Muppinēni Paruvata-Nāyaningāru ofthe village Muddireḍḍipalle situated in the Sakali-sīma inthe Ghaṇḍikōṭa-sīma held as nāyāṅkara by Mahāmaṇḍalē-śvara Nandēla Timmarājayya Nāraparājayyadēva-Mahā-rāja to god Chennakēśava-perumāḷ of Śaṅkhavaram fordaily worship and offerings.
30
Placement
Slab set up by the side of the cart trackto the west of the village.
Year
Do.
King
Veṅkaṭapatidēva-Mahārāya ‘ruling fromPenugoṇḍa’
Date
Śaka 1517, Manma-tha, Kārttika, śu.[15].
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks

Do

Remarks

35
Placement

Year
Do.
King
Kṛishṇadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 14[4]8, Vyaya,Jyēshṭha, śu. 1[3].
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Records a grant of land made to Pōrumāmiḷḷa Aṇṇā[dvara]-Nāyaka by Veṅgaḷayya, son of Rēvūri Kṛishṇamarāju, forthe construction of a well and raising of a flower-gardenand an orchard near it. The gift was made at the instance ofAṇājayya who held the pārupatyam of the Sakali-sīmaincluded in the Ghaṇḍikōṭa-sīma which was given as nāyaṅ-kara to Dēmarusayya by the king.

48
Placement
Sōmireḍḍipalle.--Slab set up near theruined temple of Śiva on the Gaṅgamma-miṭṭa, a mile east of the village.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Svabhānu, Śrāvaṇa,śu. 15, Friday,lunar eclipse.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Records the grant of the village Goḍlavīṭi Voḍḍe-Mādana-palli, now surnamed Jōtirājapuram, situated in the Sakali-pāya (division) by Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Jōtirāja Guṇḍaya-dēva-Mahārāja for the merit of his parents Jōtirāja andMaldēvī, as an agrahāra to his religious preceptor Aghōraśi-vāchārya. The chief bears the epithets Tribhuvaṇīmalla,bhuvanatriṇētra, Jagaddāḷa Pāṇḍya-gajakēsari and Niśśaṅ-kapratāpa. The gift was made in the presence of godTripurāntakadēva.

NELLORE DISTRICT VENKATAGIRI ZAMINDARI
55
Placement
Nindali.--Slab lying near a well in Sur-vey No. 63/12.
Year
Velugōṭi
King
Kumāra Yāchama-Nāyuḍu
Date
Śaka 1710, Kīlaka,Kārttika, śu.paurṇamī, Thurs-day.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Records the construction of a well and a maṇḍapa at Niṇḍaliby Śrīrāṁ Peda-Rāmanna and Chinna-Rāmanna, of theGranthīśala-gōtra who were the clerks (gumāstā) of Chenna-ppa-Śeṭṭi, the son of Dānappa-Śeṭṭi, born of the Sūgūri-vaṁśa.

Placement
Nandi-slab set up in Survey No. 38/10.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1[245], Rudhi-rōdgāri, Jyēsh-ṭha, śu. ......
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Records gift of the village Niṁḍḍapalli as sarvamānya togod Bhīmēśvara of Dākshārāma ‘the best of the fiveārāmas’ by Malevaragaṇḍa Avubhaḷanāthadēva-Mahārāja,the lord of Vēṅgīvishaya consisting of one-and-a-half lakhsof villages, and Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Apratimalla Bāchaya-Dēvachōḍa Mahārāja. On the same slab at the bottom isanother much damaged inscription in later characters, whichmentions the name of the village Niṇḍali.

ANANTAPUR DISTRICT ANANTAPUR TALUK
68
Placement
Chiyyōḍu.--Slab set up on the path nearthe mosque.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 14[8]0, Kāḷa-yukti, Āśvija, śu.[7], Friday.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a gift of the money income called Vīramushṭi-pannu of the villages in the Cheyyēṭi-sīma, made for themerit of the Siddhabikshāvṛitti-Aya and the Vīramushṭisby some śeṭṭi. Mentions the Ayyāvaḷi community.
69
Placement
Rāchānapalle.--Slab set up near a wellby the road side.
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikramayear 45, Śārvari,Jyēshṭha, amā-vāsyā, Sunday,solar eclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers grants of lands, houses and an oil-mill for a per-petual lamp, made by the chiefs Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Rēvi-yarasa, the son-in-law of Bhuvanaikamalla-Mahārāja,Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Kētamallarasa and MahāmaṇḍalēśvaraMummaḍi Chōḷarasa, to Mallikārjuna-Paṇḍita, the dēva-karmi of the god Mallikārjuna at R6eḍiyapalli, the head-quarters of Kuḍiya[ṇa]--40. The two latter chiefs bear astring of epithets such as Śikhidhvaja, Siṁhalāñchhana,Oṟeyūrpuravarādhīśvara, etc.
70
Placement
Same slab
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikramayear 47, NandanaChaitra, amā-vāsyā, Sunday,solar eclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records a grant of 1 paṇa from his vaḍḍarāvuḷa income realisedin the Kuḍiyali-sthaḷa, made by Daṇḍanāyaka Anantadēvaand a grant of one paṇa from the herjjuṅka tax made byDaṇḍanāyaka Sōvarasa and also a grant of some moneyincome made by Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Mācharasa for per-petual lamps in the temple of Mallikārjunadēva of Kuḍi-yali-sthaḷa called also Kuḍiyapeya-sthaḷa.
71
Placement
Slab set up by the road side
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikramayear 45, Vaiśākha,puṇṇame, Sunday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and mutilated. Mentions Rēviyarasa and Mum-maḍi Chōḷa[rasa], of whom the latter bears the praśasti.beginning with aridurdharavara, and registers some giftsof land, oil-mill, etc., made by them to Sidharāśi-Paṇḍita,probably the servant of god Mūlasthāna.
71a
Placement
The same slab
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date

72
Placement
Hero-stone set up by the road-side nearthe village.
Year
…
King
…
Date
17th year, Rudhi-rōdgārin, Vaiśā-kha, ba. 5,Thursday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers the manavārtte agreement relating to rents, etc.made by Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Chandarasa with his pāda-mūlas (followers or tenants). Another record on the slabseems to record the death of some hero in an attack on thevillage. Mentions Mahāpradhāna Manevergaḍe Mahā-prachaṇḍa-daṇḍanāyaka Āneya Kēśimayya.
73
Placement
Slab set up by the road-side near themodel village.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
In characters of about the 10th century A.D. Records theself-immolation of Kasavāḍa Gaṅga consequent on thedeath of (his master) Pallayya Arumu-rāju and registers agift of 12 maṟuttus of land to his memory.

84

Date
15th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Begins with the introduction Tirumagaḷpola, etc., Registersa gift of land by Teṅgaḷūr Poṉkambattaiyaṉ, a member ofthe governing body (āḷuṅgaṇam) of Vaśugūr in Vasugūr-nāḍu, a subdivision of Palkuṉṟa-kōṭṭam for providing twonāḻi of rice for offerings during the evening worship to thegoddess Ūruḍaichchelvi-Śuṉaimēṉaṅgai of the place. Theland was made tax-free by payment of iṟaidravyam andwater-fee (nīrvilai-dravyam) to the sabhā of the village byIṉakkuṭṭi Nakkaṉ alias Rājarājappēraraiyaṉ of Vāḻai-ppandal in Vāḻaippandal-nāḍu.

140
Placement
Padiyaṁbaṭṭu.--Pillars in the maṇḍapaof the Draupadi temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Beginning lost. States that the mahā-maṇḍapa and theardha-maṇḍapa, evidently of the temple, of the god Tiru-vachchiṟupākkattudēva at Koṟṟamaṅgalam was constructedof stone and also that a stone image of Ṛishabhadēva wasset up by Attimalla (Hastimalla) alias Kaṉṉaradēva Pṛithi-vīgaṅgaraiyaṉ, son of Vayiri Aḍigaḷ, and ruler of Kallaḍup-pūr-maryādā and that he gave the village Koṟṟamaṅgalamfor providing offerings to the deity and for feeding dailyeight Brāhmaṇas. A portion of the historical introduction ofRājarāja I beginning with the words ‘Tirumagaḷpōla’ etc.,is found close by. Another inscription on a pillar in thesame place states that Perumānaḍigaḷ wishing to respect thegift of Pṛithivīgaṅgaraiyar issued an order to this effectthrough his adhikāri Mugaiyūruḍaiyāṉ and MīnavaṉMuvēndavēḷāṉ.

149
Placement
Narasiṅgapuram.--Both sides of slabset up in a private land.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Sadāśivadēva Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1482, Raudri,Tulā, śu. 10, Mon-day, Anusham.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the formation of a pāḷaiyam in Narasiṅganallūr situat-ed in Tachchūr-nāḍu, a division of Murugamaṅgalapaṟṟu,in Palkuṉṟak-kōṭṭam, in the name of Tirumalai-Nāyaka,son of Muttu-Liṅgappa-Nāyaka, by E1kappa-Nāyaka. Emi-grants of all castes were permitted to settle on it withoutpayment of any taxes for three years, but thereafter a feeof 3 paṇam per annum was levied on each family. Sadāśivais given the titles Tribhuvanarāyagūḷi and Śaṁbuvarāya-sthāpanāchārya.

155
Placement
Tachāṁbāḍi.--Walls of the gōpura of theJain temple and south wall of theruined Śiva temple on the hillock.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Dēvarāya-Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 136., .... śu.10, Thursday, Punar-pūśam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
The gōpura of the Jain temple was constructed with the stonesfrom the ruined Śiva temple on the hillock. Some of theinscribed stones are missing. Seems to record the decisionarrived at by the Valaṅgai and Iḍaṅgai communities grantingcertain villages to the temple of Ammaiappa-Nāyiṉār atMarudaraśar-Paḍaivīḍu with the right of collecting a smallcess (aḷḷu) in them. Also states that these communitiesbestowed upon Tiruvēṅgaḷanāthar, son of Malai-Appanā-yakkar, the title ‘Maṟaipukkār-kāvalaṉ.’

Do. Damaged. Records an order of the ūrār and thetānattār of the temple granting 3 mā of land as kāṇiyāṭchi,probably to the accountant (of the temple).

Placement

Year

Date

Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

Year
…
King

Date

Tamil & Sanskrit in Grantha
Remarks
In characters of the 15th century A.D. Fragmentary andends of lines chiselled. The kings, SarvajñaSōmēśvara-Nṛipati, Pinnama, Kōnapēndra-nṛipati, Viṭha-lēśvara and Timma Bhūpa are also mentioned towardsthe end of the inscription.

261
Placement
Above the platform of the same gōpura(proper right).
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1714, Parīdāpi,Paṅguṉi 24, Wednes-day, śu. 2, Rēvatī.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
States that during the administration of Gōpālarāya underAhamad Khadar Saheb and Hazarat Nababu Saheb whenHazarat Kepilai Nababu Saheb was ruling the country, oneKuṭṭi, son of Vayiṟāvi Muttukaṟuppaṉ, fell from the gōpura(and died) as a protest against the demolition of the templesof Śokkanātha and Paḻaṉiyāṇḍavaṉ for which (his descen-dant) was granted a pāḷaiyam as rattakkāṇikkai makingprovision for providing offerings to the god daily.

Vīrappa Nāyaka
Date
Pramādi, Puraṭṭāśi16.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged and built in at the end. Refers to a quarrel amonghis servants (śēḍar), evidently about the levy on betel-leaves and areca-nuts in Madura and Rādhāpuram-śīrmaiand to the remission of the same by the Nāyaka ruler.
283
Placement
Inner wall of the same gōpura
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
Bhāva, Aṟppaśi 8
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the remission of the caste levy (jātivari) on Reḍḍisin the 4 śīmais of the Madura kingdom.
284
Placement
Same place.
Year
Do.
King
Viśvanātha-Nāyaka Vīrappa-Nāyaka

Śaka 153[1], Saumya,Āṉi, [1]5, Pūśam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

288

Do.

289
Placement
Stone planted in the Mīnākshi-Nāyakamaṇḍapa.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1764, Śubhakṛit
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the provision made for daily worship in the ŚrīMīnākshi Ammaṉ shrine at Madura from the interest onone lakh of pagōḍas endowed by Kāñchīpuram PachchayappaMudaliyār. Also provides for the appointment of a tutoron 10 varāhaṉ for a month for teaching law (vivakāra-śāstra)and another on 5 varāhaṉ for teaching English to Hindu boysof the locality. (See also No. 145 of 1938-39).

King
Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara GaṇapatidēvaMahārāja, ruling from O1ragal.
Date

Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Registers a gift of some vṛittis of land in two villages made byMāmala Mallaya, a feudatory of the king to god Vīśva-nātha at Siddhēśvara whose temple was constructed inthe name of Viśvēśvara Śivadēva, the Rājaguru of Gaṇa-patidēva Mahārāja. The management of the endowedland was handed over to Pōchirāju Veṅgana Pegaḍa, theagent of Vidyāśivadēva, who was the sthānapati ofSaṁgamēśvara and Bhāskarakshētra.

43
Placement
Slab set up on the paved way leadingfrom the southern gōpura of the Malli-kārjuna temple to the Cheñchu colony.
Year
Reḍḍi
King
…
Date
Śaka 1327, Pārthiva,Chaitra, ba. 10,Wednesday.
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
States that Kāṭamareḍḍi Vēmireḍḍi constructed the stonesteps leading to Śikharēśvara for the spiritual merit of Koma-ragirireḍḍi and his queen (Ammaṅgāru). Komaragirireḍḍibears the epithets, Jaganobbagaṇḍa and Gajapati-vibhāḍa,among others.

54
Placement
A mutilated slab lying in the sameplace.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks
Damaged and fragmentary. Records the founding of a villagecalled Gaṇapavuram in the name of his mother and makinga gift of it to god Śrīgirinātha (i.e., Mallikārjuna at Śrī-śailam) by the general Kāchaya Reḍḍi who bore the epithet,Mahārāyasthāpanāchārya (the establisher of the great king)and who is said to have vanquished the Muhammadanruler that had penetrated into the Telugu country afterconquering the Gauḷa, Gūrjara, Māḷava, Mahārāshṭra andother provinces. He is stated to be the son of MailayaReḍḍi who placed on a firm footing the Kākita throne (pīṭha).In characters of the 13th century A.D.
55
Placement
Broken pillar set up in the compound ofof a Śiva temple to the west of andwithin the prākāra of the Mallikārjunatemple.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Vīra-Harihara-Mahārāja, son ofBukka.
Date
…
Language and Script
Sanskrit verse in Telugu characters
Remarks
Records the installation of a liṅgam named Triyaṁbaka forthe prosperity of his family, by Anantarasa, son of GōparasaDaṁḍanātha and grandson of Baichaya Daṇḍanāthawho was the hereditary minister of king Bukka. Gōparasais stated to be the minister of Harihara.

59
Placement

Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1089 (in chro-nogram), Āshāḍha,[śu. 5 ?].
Language and Script
Sanskrit & Telugu in Telugu characters
Remarks
Damaged and fragmentary. Records the gift of a perpetuallamp to the god Mallikārjuna of Śrīśaila by Vīra-Rājēndra-Chōḷa. Gives a string of birudas of the chief, among whichmay be noted the title denoting his lordship over the townIndulūru in Pākanāḍu (Pākanāṁṭi-Yindulūri-purāṅganā-vallabha).

Tamil

Tamil

Placement
South wall of the same shrine.
Year
Pāṇḍya
King
Tribh. Vikrama-Pāṇḍyadēva, ‘who waspleased to conquer every country’.
Date
4th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records an order (ōlai) of Pṛithivī-Gaṅgaṉ alias Arasanā-yaṉ Tiruvaṇṇamalai Perumāḷ granting one vēli of land, freeof taxes, in Gaṅgakulamādēvinallūr for providing offerings,worship, etc., to the god Gaṅgarkulamādēvīśuram-uḍaiya-Nāyaṉār, set up by his mother Nāḍāḷvār.

Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks

Language and Script

Remarks

Wednesday
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Damaged. An image of Āñjanēya is carved over the frontface of the inscription. Seems to record the grant of thevillage Kēḷūr remitting a number of specified taxes on it, asa jīvita to Ma[kka]nāyaṉ Māḷuvachchakravarti.

99-100
Placement
Turiñjikuppam.--Two stones set upby the side of the Śiva temple in ruins.
Year
Do.
King
Kṛishṇarāya
Date
Śaka 1432, (inchronogram), Śukla,Bōdhinī-ēkādaśī.
Language and Script
Sanskrit in Telugu
Remarks
Much damaged. Records that Śiva-Dīkshita, son of Malla-māmbā, who was learned and had performed many makhas,obtained the village Kiñjalikuppam from the king and afterconstructing two tanks, gave it to four of his relatives whowere subjected to the conditions that they should not bearany ill-will amongst themselves, nor mingle matrimoniallywith other castes, should be ardent in the study of the Vēdasand Śāstras and should worship only gods like Vishṇu orĪśvara and not evil deities.

105
Placement
Kalkuppam.--Slab set up in a privateland.
Year
Do.
King
Vīra-Veṅkaṭapatirāyadēva Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1517, Manma-tha, Siṁha, śu. 12,Wednesday Utti-rāḍam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift of the village Kīḻnāgasamudram-Mēlnāgasa-mudram alias Tuvarakāḷanēndalsamudram in Murugamaṅ-galam in Tachchūr-nāḍu, a sub-division of Palkuṇṟak-kōṭṭam in the Paḍaivīḍu division of Jayaṅgoṇḍaśḷōamaṇḍa-lam, by Bommu Nāyaka, son of Nāgama Nāyaka and grandson of Tippu Nāyaka for providing worship daily and forspecial worship on the day of dvādaśī for the merit of NāgamaNāyaka in the temple of Araṇi Kailāsanātha. The villagegranted is stated to have been formerly given by Vēṅkaṭa-patirāya to Kumbakōṇam Tātāchārya and that it was nowobtained from Kumāra Tātāchārya.

112

King

Date

Language and Script
Telugu
Remarks

Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Ends of lines built in. Records gift of 1000 kuḻi of land inthe village of Siṅgapura to the temples of god Tiru[mēṟ-ṟaḷi]dēvar and another (name lost) at Neṉmali for soundingmusic during the Śrībali service by Śāttandai Śutthamallaṉalias Pallavaraiyaṉ.
155
Placement
Do.
Year
Chōḷa
King
Parakēsarivarman
Date
2nd year (in words)
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Ends of lines built in and incomplete. Begins with thehistorical introduction Iraṭṭapāḍi ēḻaṟaiy-ilakkamum etc.Records sale of 500 kuḻi of land by the mahā-sabhā of Chaḷuk-ki[kulakāla-chaturvēdimaṅgalam] for maintaining a per-petual lamp in the temple.
156
Placement
South wall of the maṇḍapa in front of thesame shrine.
Year
Do.
King
Rājarājakēsarivarman alias Rājarāja-dēva.
Date
25th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Beginning of lines lost. Commences with the historicalintroduction Kāndaḷūrśālai, etc. Gives the details of taxesleviable on crops raised on different kinds of lands evidentlyby the sabhā of Śaḷukkikulakāla-chaturvēdimaṅgalam. Adeath duty of (1/4) poṉ is also stated to be leviable on theBrāhmaṇa community which was to be utilised for the benefitof the (local) tank. The document is stated to have beenwritten by Śattiśēndaṉ Muppattiruvaṉ alias Maṅgalapriyaṉ,the madhyastha of the village.

164

Year
Vijayanagara
King
Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Harihararāya
Date
Pramādhin, Kar-kaṭaka.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records that Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Māchā-Reḍḍi-Gaṇapati-Reḍḍiyār, who bears the titles, Addaṅki-siṁhāsanādhīśvara,Jagadobbagaṇḍa, Basavaśaṅkara, etc., constructed a sluicefor the tank at Śīyapāḍi alias Uttamaśōḻanallūr and thathe provided for its dredging by authorising the fish-leasemoney derived from it to be utilized for the purpose.

171
Placement
East, north and west walls of the sameshrine.
Year
…
King
…

172
Placement
South wall of the Mahā-maṇḍapa (leftof entrance) in the same temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1640, Viḷaṁbi,Kārttikai 14, Pañ-chamī, Monday.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
States that Muttu Maṉṉārappa Nāyakkar, son of Veḷḷakoṇ-ḍama Nāyaka and grandson of Muttula Nāyaka, completedthe construction of the central shrine and the mahāmaṇḍapafor the deities Chōḷēśvarasvāmi and his consort, besidesgōpuras, shrines for Vighnēśvara and other parivāradēvatās,a sabhāmaṇḍapa and a tank. On the same stone is engravedfurther on, under date Śaka 1670, Vibhava, Kārttikai 28,Pañchamī, Monday, an inscription which states that MuttuVeḷḷakkoṇḍama Nāyakkar, son of Muttu MaṉṉārappaNāyakkar mentioned above, repaired the idol of the goddessand that he constructed a ten-pillared maṇḍapa for thetemple.

183
Placement
Raghunāthapuram.--Stone set up in afield to the west of the village.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Kṛishṇadēva Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1436 (in words),Yuva, Makara, śu.10, Monday, Tiṛuvō-ṇam.
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records a royal gift, made on the occasion of Saṅkrama-puṇyakāla from the banks of the river Tuṅgabhadrā, of thevillage Tyāgachchēri in Malaippaṟṟu situated in Perumūr-nāḍu, a sub-division of Kuṉṟavattanakōṭṭam to god Raghu-nātha at Neḍumbiṟai. The figure of a chakra is cut belowthe inscription and on the back of the stone.

…
Date

Rājarājadēva

197
Placement
Hariśchandrapuram alias Kāṭramōṭū-ru.--Stone set up in the village.
Year
…
King
Pārthivēndrādhipativarman
Date
10th year
Language and Script
Tamil
Remarks
Records the gift of land after purchase as ērippaṭṭi by Pāra-dāyaṉ Nārāyaṇaṉ Amudaṉ of Kuladīpamaṅgalam, a brahma-dēya, situated on the south bank in Śōṇāḍu. The donor isdescribed as a kaṉmi of Pallavamārāyar and is stated tohave obtained for his livelihood (jīvitam) the village ofKāṭṭukkumuṇḍūr in Mēṉmalai-Paḻaiyaṉūr-nāḍu, asub-division of Maṉaiyiṟ-kōṭṭam.

Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1939-40.


NORTH KANARA DISTRICT SIRSI TALUK
1
Placement
Bakkaḷ.--Broken slab in the compoundof the Satyanāthēśvara temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka....Āṁgirasa, Bhādra,śu. 4.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Indifferently written; seems to record some gifts in money.
2
Placement
Hero-stone in the danada bayalu
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Badly damaged and worn out. In characters of about the13th century A.D. Seems to mention Śiṁgha.
3
Placement
Hero-stone (No. I) set up in the com-pound of the Satyanāthēśvara temple.
Year
Kadaṁba
King
Tailamadēva
Date
...., Bhādrapada,bahuḷa daśamī,Thursday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Badly damaged and worn out. Mentions the god Gōkarṇa-Mahābala and paṭṭamahādēvi Laḷiyādēvī. Seems to recordthe gift of some money in memory of a warrior who diedin a fight. Mentions also Durgādēvī and Kāmadēvī.These were perhaps his wives.
4
Placement
Another hero-stone (No. II) at the sameplace.
Year
Do.
King
Lost
Date
...., Piṁgaḷa,dīpavāḷige (dīpā-vaḷige), amāvāse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Partly broken and damaged. In characters of about the 12thcentury A.D. Mentions a Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara who was aworshipper of the god Mahābala of Gōkarṇa and seems torecord the death of Mēdagauḍana Bīvarasa of Bakkaṇain the battle at Puṇije. Mentions Pradhāna Sāṁtaveg-gaḍe Bommagauḍa, the younger brother of Mēdagauḍaand Banavase Bairōja.
5
Placement
Barūr.--Hero-stone (No. I) set up inthe village.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Paridhāvi
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Badly damaged and worn out. The characters belong toabout the 12th century A.D. Refers to the ‘Guttiya-rājya’ and one Masaṇeyanāyaka's son (name lost) whoprobably died in a battle.
6
Placement
Another hero-stone (No. II) at the sameplace.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Vikāri
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Badly damaged and worn out. In characters of about the13th century A.D. Purport not clear.
7
Placement
Another hero-stone (No. III) at the sameplace.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1[3]87, Vyaya,Phālguṇa, ba. 5,Tuesday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and partly worn out. Seems to refer to the requisi-tion of Kaleya-Daṁṇāyaka, son of Sātiya-Daṁṇāyaka toChandragutti. Seems to mention some Āḷuva-Mahā-prabhu (name not clear).
8
Placement
Bāḷehaḷḷi.--Māsti stone in a lawn
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. In characters of about the 17thcentury A.D. Mentions Bīragauḍa of Bāḷeyahaḷḷi.
9
Placement
Chaḷgār.--Rock in the bed of a ravinein the forest.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Rākshasa, Chaitra,śu. 1.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 18th century A.D. Mentions thestone-cutter (kalakuṭuka) Dēvaya.
10
Placement
Hero-stone lying in the same forest
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka Saṁvat 1400,Vikāri, Pushya,śu. 2.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Indifferently written and damaged. Seems to record thedeath of a follower of Arasappa-Nāyaka. Refers to Beḷu-goḷa.
11
Placement
Chippagi.--Slab standing in front of thedilapidated Īśvara temple.
Year
Western Chālukya
King
Bhuvanaikamalla
Date
Śaka [995, Pari-dhāvi], Kārtika,śu. 13, Uttara-bhādrapada.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers the construction of a tank, the erection of a Śivatemple called Jakkēśvara at Sippake and gift of land forthe same by four gāvuṇḍas when MahāmaṇḍalēśvaraTailapadēva was governing Banavāsi-Twelve Thousand.Mentions in the preamble that Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Kīrti-dēva was ruling the same territory. Refers to Sāntayya-dēva as administering the Mogalenāḍu-70 division.
12
Placement
Dēvatēmane.--Slab lying in the forestnear the village.
Year
Do.
King
Iṟiva beḍeṁga Satyāśraya
Date
Śaka 928, Parā-bhava, Vaiśākha,śu. pāḍiva,Sunday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Refers to Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Chaṭṭayya as the governor ofBanavāsi-Twelve Thousand and records the gift of landmade by Jegatimabbe-Gāvuṇḍi before her demise.

14
Placement
Hero-stone set up near the Bhadrakāḷitemple.
Year
Kadaṁba
King
Tailamadēva, son of Tribhuvana-malladēva.
Date
Year 11, Īśvara,Pushya, .....12,Wednesday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Broken and damaged. Relates that Komma-Gauḍa put upa heroic fight against the infantry and the cavaliers ofMallidēva, son of Kāvadēva and died in the battle of Kalu-gāla when the latter made a march and encamped atBallāḷa-Sirise.
15
Placement
Honnēhaḷḷi.--Slab set up near the Nara-siṁha temple in the Svarṇavalli Maṭha.
Year
Sōde
King
Savāyi Rāmachandra-Nāyaka
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka1595, Pramādi,Māgha, śu. 4,Saturday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records the performance and completion of a sacrifice forthe prosperity of the chief by His Holiness Sarvajña-Sarasvatī Śrīpāda of Honnēhaḷḷi through Viśvapati-Bhaṭṭawho was brought down from Kāśī (Benares). The stonedepicts in relief the vēdī of the agnihōtra maṁṭapa withthe three holy fire-pits.

Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that Paṁchavaṭe-O1jiga, son of Biyaḷaiya who wasadministering (kāyika) the Teṁgere-Thirty (division)endowed some money to the Mahājanas of Isuḻūru for agōsāsa and set up the stone (pillar). The chief was thelord of Banavāsi Twelve Thousand and Sāntaḷige Thousand.

45
Placement
Kalkuṇi.--Slab standing in the site ofan old temple near the village.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Harihara Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1317, Yuva,Pushya, śu. 15,lunar eclipse(sōpadhā-sōmō-parāga).
Language and Script
Kannaḍa in Nāgarī
Remarks
Records the endowment, to please god Madukanātha,of the village Kalukaṇi by the chief Karuvūra Sānta-Daṇṇāyaka and the several gauṇḍas of the Kabunāligeya-nāḍu included in the Chandragutti division of eighteenKampaṇas into the hands of Siriyaṇa Mādapa, after pur-chasing it from him. Siriyaṇa Mādapa who was entrustedwith the endowment bestowed it on learned Brāhmaṇaswell-versed in the shaṭkarmas and the śāstras dividing thesame into twelve vṛittis, as an agrahāra called Lakshmī-pura, on Māgha ba. 30 of the same year.

62
Placement
Sahasraḷḷi.--Slab set up in the Rāmē-śvara temple.
Year
Kaḷachurya
King
Rāyamurāri Sōvidēva
Date
Year 4, Vijaya,Phālguṇa, Puṇṇ-ami, Monday,lunar eclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records the installation of a liṅga by Kabbila-Gāvuṇḍa and gifts of land made by him and others to thegod when the feudatory Kadaṁba MahāmaṇḍaḷēśvaraKīrtidēva was governing the province of Banavāse-12,000from Hānuṁgal. Mentions Hu[li]ya-Daṇḍanāyaka as theadministrator of Kabunālige-70 division. The gift wasmade into the hands of Mahadēva-Paṇḍita of Banavāse.

Do.
King
Dēvarāya Mahārāya, son of Vijaya-Bukkarāya.
Date
Śaka 1354, Virōdhi-kṛit, Chaitra, ba. 1,Thursday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Refers to the king as reigning from Dōrasamudra(and) Vijayanagara-nelevīḍu. Seems to record the deathtogether with his nine wives, of Arasappa, son of SaṅkaṇāSōvade who bears some titles.
72
Placement
Boulder called Basavana baṇḍe
Year
…
King
…
Date
Vikāri, Kārtika, śu.4, Thursday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 18th century A.D. Records thegrant of a land by Arasappa-Nāyaka made to the Nirāsi-maṭha. At the top is given an invocation to Guruliṅga.
73

King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Indifferently engraved. Characters of about the 18th centuryA.D. States that the land is a gift by [Arasappa-Nāyaka]to the Nirāsi-maṭha.
74
Placement
The ḍhvajastaṁbha set up in front of theTrivikrama temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka1562, Vikrama, Jyē-shṭha, śu. 5, Mon-day.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that the pillar was set up by Śrī-Vēdanidhi-Tīrtha,the grand-disciple (praśishya) of Śrī-Vādirāja-Tīrtha.
75
Placement
Slab set up at a distance to the south ofthe same temple
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Veṅkaṭapatidēva Mahārāya
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka1515, Vijaya, Kār-tika, śu. 15.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that Śrī-Vādirajātīrtha constructed the temple andinstalled the image of Trivikrama while the chief Arasappa-Nāyaka was ruling at Sōde. Describes in detail the assignmentof several grain and money incomes made by Śrī Vādirājafor the services in the temple. A post-script in later charac-ters states that Śālivāhana Śaka 1505, Chitrabhānu, Vai-sākha, śu. 15, Wednesday was the muhūrta of the installationof the god Trivikrama.
76
Placement
Slab standing in a lawn (survey No. 79)near the Jain Maṭha.
Year
Do.
King
Sadāśivarāya Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1491 (in chro-nogram), Vibhava,Māgha, śu. 5,Monday.
Language and Script
Sanskṛit & Kannaḍa in Kannaḍa
Remarks
The composition is faulty. Records the gift of land made forthe maintenance of a satra in a maṭha at Sōdāpurī by Arasamma,daughter of the chief Arasappa-Nāyaka with the permissionof the king. The chief is stated to belong to the Śūryavaṁśa.Mention is made of the Sēnabōva Timmarasa of the Kauśikagōtra and Āśvalāyana-sūtra.

82
Placement
Yasaḷe.--Pillar (No. 4) of the first groupof nine pillars set up in the forest nearthe village.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 10th century A.D. States thatKoṇḍaṟa, Guṇakamma performed the gōsāsa for the secondtime, and that Eṟechaṭṭa the son of Eṟegāri-ōja, carvedthis stone. Above the epigraph is sculptured the figure ofa plough drawn by two bulls. The first three pillars bearno writing.
83
Placement
Pillar (No. 5) set up in the same place.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Vyatīpāta, solareclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that Tāliyara Vuṭṭayya of Tāḷavūru performed thegōsāsa. May be a continuation from pillar No. 8 (No. 86).There is a sculpture of plough and bulls above the inscription.
84
Placement
Pillar (No. 6) set up in the same place
Year
[Kadaṁba]
King
Chaṭṭayyadēva
Date
Śaka 901, Sarvajit,Āśvayuja, amāvāse.
Language and Script

86
Placement
Pillar (No. 8) set up in the same place.
Year
Kadaṁba
King
Chaṭṭayyadēva
Date
Śaka 907, Pārthiva,Pausha, amāvāse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa

87
Placement
Pillar (No. 9) set up in the same place
Year
Do.
King
Chaṭṭayyadēva
Date

Language and Script
Kannaḍa

Placement

Year
Kadaṁba
King
Chaṭṭayyadēva
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seems to be a continuation from the above inscription.Mentions Chaṭṭayyadēva as governing Banavāsi Twelve-Thousand and Chaṭṭayya and Dēvayya Maṇṇachaiyya asperforming perbbārvvu at Esaḻe. Contains the sculpture oftwo bulls with a plough. Kannayya is stated to be conductingthe perggaḍetana.
92
Placement
Pillar (No. 6) set up in the same place
Year
…
King
…
Date
Chaitra, Saṁkrānti
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seems to be a continuation of from No. 91 above. Records theperformance of gōsāsa by Andabaḷḷiya Raggasa Garuvaṇṇa.Contains the sculpture in high relief of Gaṇēśa in ashrine above the inscription and ‘the Talkative tortoise andthe swans’ on the reverse side. The swans are depictedin a different attitude from that in No. 84 above.
93
Placement
Hero-stone (No. 1) set up in a meadownear the above.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Mallikārjunarāya, son of Dēvarāya
Date
Śaka 1370, Prabhava,Māgha, ba. 8,Monday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Refers to the king's capital as Hastināvati-Vijayanagara andrecords the gift of land at Yasaḷe, made to the son of Bīra-Nāyaka who died in a fight at the village Biḷigeṟe, by thepeople of Hariya-nāḍu and the local gauḍas. MentionsBācheya-Nāyaka of Aṇṇigēri.

KUMTA TALUK
96
Placement
Gōkarṇ.--Slab set up above the westernentrance of the raṅgamaṇḍapa of theMahābalēśvara temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śārvari, Kārtika,śu. ..........
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 18th century A.D. States thatthe construction of the raṅgamaṁṭapa was completed duringthe management (pārupatya) of Viśvēśvarayya of Malasu-nāḍu.
97
Placement
Slab built in the pavement of the frontcorridor in the same temple.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Dēvarāya Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1[3]39, (inwords), Durmukhi,Chaitra, śu. 2,Sunday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records a gift of land for the maintenance of a satra in thetemple of the god Mahābala of Gōkarṇa when MahāpradhānaBaṁkarasa-Voḍeya's son (name lost) was governing theprovince of Hayive, Tuḷu and Koṁkaṇa from his capital atHoṁnāvura. Seems also to record a gift of land for feedingthe ascetics of three communities (parishat).

Placement
Pillar set up on the left side of the southernentrance of the same temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks

99
Placement
Pillar set up on the right side in the sameplace.
Year
…
King
…

100
Placement
Fragment built into the wall of the Tāmragauri temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seriously mutilated. In characters of about the 15th centuryA.D. Records gift of the village Hosa-ūru to Mābala-Liṅga-Bhaṭṭa for maintaining a charitable boarding house (chhatra)in the temple of the goddess Tāṁbragauri by MahāpradhānaMaṁju-Nāyaka. The supervision of the charity was vestedin the hands of Rāghavēndra-Śrīpāda of the Dēvarāya-Maṭhaat Haṁpe.
101
Placement
Slab lying in the garden of Gopī Bhaṭadjoining the Mahābala temple.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Bukkarāya Mahārāya
Date

Language and Script
Kannaḍa in Nāgarī
Remarks
Damaged and mutilated. In characters of the 14th centuryA.D. Seems to record tax-free endowment (sarvamānya)of land by [B]asaveya-Daṇāyaka with the sanction of Bu-kkarāya to Paramahaṁsa Parivrājakāchārya Śrī-Vēdasāgara-Śrīpāda for lamps and offerings to (the god) Vēdēśvara ofGōkarṇa. Mentions the nāḍu of the twelve shares of thevillage Hubbaṇakeṟe.

104
Placement
Slab set up in the house of Śiva Bhaṭ Aḍi
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Harihara Mahārāya reigning from thenelevīḍu at Dōrasamudra.

Date

Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks

106
Placement
Slab set up in the dilapidated Honnehaḷḷi-maṭha.
Year
Do.
King
Bukkarāya Mahārāya
Date

Language and Script
Kannaḍa in Nāgarī
Remarks
Slightly damaged. Records in detail the assignment of theincome derived from the lands endowed in the presence ofthe god Mahābala by Honnādēvī, queen of Bukkarāya, fora feeding house and offerings to the deity when Mallappa-Oḍeya was governing the province of [Hai]ve.

110
Placement
Slab standing in the Kāmēśvara-maṭha
Year
Kadaṁba
King
Kāvadēvarasa, son of Śivachitta Era-Basavidēvarasa.

111
Placement
Slab lying near the Paṭṭa Gaṇapati temple

Harihara Mahārāya
Date

112
Placement
Slab standing in the house of Morēbhaṭ
Year
Do.
King
Dēvarāya Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 1332, Virōdhi,Kārtika, śu. 9,Wednesday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Partly damaged. Registers gift of land in the Baṁgane-nāḍu made to Amarēśvara Bhāratī-Śrīpāda in the presenceof the god Mahābala for the maintenance of a chhatra byVissaṇṇa, the son of Siddappa of the Vīśvāmitra-gōtra.Also records gift of land for a chhatra founded by Rāma-chandra-Sarasvati-Śrīpāda in the name of Biṭhapa-Oḍeya.Mahāpradhāna [Sōma]appa-Oḍeya was governing theprovinces of Hayive, Tuḷu and Koṁkaṇa from his capitalat Hoṁnāvura.
113
Placement
Slab built in the wall inside the houseof Hire Bhat.
Year
Do.
King
Sadāśivarāya Mahārāya
Date
Śaka 147[5], Paridhā-vi, Simha-Guru,Pushya, ba. 30,Monday, Śravaṇa-nakshatra, solareclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers endowments of lands made for the benefit of maṭhas,rituals and other purposes such as charities in the renovatedtemple of Vaiśravaṇēśvara by Bhaṭṭakala Gaṇapaṇa-Jōyisaand others having purchased the same from certain pontiffsand bhaṭṭas when Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Sāḷuva Kṛishṇadēva-rasa-Oḍeya was governing the provinces of Nagira-rājya,Hayive, Tuḷu Koṁkaṇa, etc. Assignment and manage-ment of the several incomes are set forth in full detail.

Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1940-41.


BELGAUM DISTRICT PARASGAD TALUK
1
Placement
Arṭagaḷ: Slab set up near the Kala-mēśvara temple.
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
Chālukya-Vikramayear 24, ..........Śu. 5, Thursday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records gift of land for the salvation (?) (parōksha-dharma)of Narasuga who attained heaven by entering the sacrificialfire-pit, amidst the admiration of the people, at the demisealong with his consort of his liege-lord, Dēvati, the sonof Mahāsāmanta Chikkarasa and the commander of the Tuḷuguards who were the body-guard of the king.
2
Placement
Asuṇḍi: Stone set up in the Banaśaṅ-karī temple.
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
Śaka 1015, Śrīmukha,Uttarāyaṇa-saṁk-rānti, Vyatīpāta.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records gifts of land to god Śaṅkara-Nārā-yaṇa after purchasing it from the Two Hundred Mahā-janas of Hiriya-Hasuṇḍi which was a sarvamānya-nityabhūmidāna endowment of the king. Mentions land atMāṇikēśvara.
3
Placement
Fragment lying in the same temple
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Invokes the Jinaśāsana. Mentions the Two Hundred Mahājanas (of Asuṇḍi) who were versed in the Ṛig, Yajus, Sāmaand Atharvaṇa Vēdas and in the six tarkas. Asuṇḍiwas a sarvanamasya-nitya-bhūmidāna endowment of theking.
4
Placement
Baḍli: Pillar in the Chidaṁbarēśvaratemple.
Year
Hoysaḷa
King
Vī[ra-Ballaḷa]......II (?)
Date
Vaiśākha, śu. 7
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
The pillar is reported to have been brought from Aṇṇīgēr(Dharwar district). Published in the Karnatak Inscriptions.Vol. I (1941), No. 29.
5
Placement
Fragment set up in the Nārāyaṇa temple
Year

King
Kārtavīrya
Date

8
Placement
Slab built in the pedestal of the image ofgod Nārāyaṇa at the same place.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 18th century A.D. Seems to statethat the image is the jīrṇōddhāraṇa (reconsecration) made byMudeya, son of Chapa of Thavaṭi.
9
Placement
Hero-stone set up behind the Saṁga-mēśvara temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. In characters of about the 13thcentury A.D. Describes the valour of two warriors whodied in the fight for the recovery of cows from the hands ofthe enemy in a cattle raid. One of these is Basava-Gāvuṇḍa.The name of the other is not clear.
10
Placement
Slab lying in the dēsagati-hola
Year
[Raṭṭa]
King
Kārtavīryadēva ‘ruling from Vēṇu-grāma’.
Date
Śaka 1124, Durmati,Kārtika, śu. 11,Monday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records gift of land to the god Saṁgamēśvara bythe Ūroḍeya Vāmarasa and others of the mahāgrahāraChachchaki. The gift was made into the hands of Nāgarā-sidēva.
11
Placement
Chik-Budnūr: Hero-stone built into thewall of the temple of Lakkavva.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Dēvarāya
Date
Śaka 1358, Nala,Phālguṇa, śu. 15,Thursday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seems to record the death of the warrior Nāgaṇa in a fightand his attaining the vīrasvarga.

14
Placement
Hosūr: Broken slab set up near theBasavaṇṇa temple.
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Much damaged. Refer to Kūṇḍi-Three Thousand (division)and to the Raṭṭa chief [Barma]dēvarasa probably ruling overit. Mentions also some gāvuṇḍas.
15
Placement
Two fragments set up near the sametemple.
Year
[Raṭṭa]
King
Lakshmīdēva, ‘ruling from his head-quarters at Vēṇupura’.
Date
Śaka 1030, Sarva-dhārin, Pushya,śu. 5, Monday,Uttarāyaṇa-saṁk-rānti.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. It is a Jina-śāsana. Records gift of land by thechief to a basadi built by himself. Mentions some Jainateachers.

17
Placement
Hūli: Slab set up in the Pañchaliṅgatemple.
Year
Kaḷachurya
King
Rāyanārāyaṇa Āhavamalladēva, sonof Vīra-Bijjaṇadēva.
Date
Śaka 1103, Plava,Vaiśākha, śu. 14,Wednesday, Vya-tīpāta.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records a gift of land for the water-shed (ara-vaṇṭe) to the venerable One Hundred of Ghaisāsagēri and theūroḍeya of Pūli in the town-hall of the Tiguḷas (Tamilians)in the place, by Prabhu Sōma of the Bhāradvāja-gotra. Alsorecords gifts of land to the God Tiguḷēśvara and for therenovation of the town-hall of the Tiguḷas (Tamilians) bythe respectable One Hundred of Ghaisāsagēri.

Kannaḍa
Remarks

38
Placement
Fragment built into the wall of the Sid-dhanañjēśa-maṭha.
Year
…
King
Vīra-Vijayarasa
Date

Kannaḍa
Remarks

Date
Do.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks

53

Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 14th century A.D. Containsabbreviations showing the directions of the wall and thenumber of rounds, possibly meant to facilitate the masonsin arranging the several stones of the walls.

Placement

…

63
Placement
A stone with damaged Jaina figures setup near Kariyavvana-guḍi.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. In characters of about the 12th century A.D.States that this nisidige stone was set up in memory ofMunichandradēva of Munivaḷḷi, belonging to the Yāpanīya-saṁgha by his lay disciple Gaṁgeve, daughter of KuḷḷeyaKēta-gāvuḍa. This states that Munichandradēva was theĀchārya of the basti founded by one Siryādēvī.
64
Placement
Another stone of a similar nature set up inthe same place.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Sādhā[raṇa], Āśva-yuja, Kṛishṇa-pak-sha, 5, Friday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. In characters of about the 12th century A.D.Records the demise of Pālyakī[rti]dēva, the spiritual son ofMunichandra[dēva] of Munivaḷḷi of the Yāpanīya-saṁgha,on the given date.

67
Placement
Murgōḍ:--Slab set up in the Mallikārjunatemple.
Year
Vijayanagara
King
Vīra Sadāśivarāya Mahārāya
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka1473, Virōdhikṛit[Jyēshṭha], ba. [8],Monday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seriously damaged and worn out. Registers the gift of landmade for the worship, etc., of god Mallikārjuna, by MurugōḍuPedi-Nāyaka, the agent of Mahāmaṇḍaḷēśvara Bāchirāja-Narasarājayyadēva-Mahā-arasu.
68
Placement
Slab set up at the back of the Vīrabhadratemple.
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka 14-6[9], Plavaṅga,Āshāḍha, śu. 11,[Sunday].
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers the remission of the terige (tax) on the barbers ofthe villages in the Toṟagale-sīme in favour of Timmōja,Koṇḍōja and Bhadrōja of the community.
69
Placement
Slab lying near the dilapidated temple ofBeṭṭada Īraṇṇa.
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
Trailōkyamalladēva
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikramayear 9, Krōdhana,Uttarāyaṇa-saṁkr-ānti, Vyatīpāta.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Registers the gift of Nāgarapāḷainto the hands of [Mailāraśakti]-Paṇḍita for feeding theascetics and worship of the god Bhōgēśvara at Mudugaḍe,whose temple was constructed at the instance of Mahā-maṇḍaḷēśvara [Koṁgāḷvarasa], who was governing KūṁḍiThree-Thousand and Miṟiṁje Three-Thousand.
70
Placement
Same slab
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalla Sōmēśvara
Date
Śaka [974], Naṁdana,Chaitra, śu. [1],Sunday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Do. Registers an endowment of money into the hands ofthe merchants (nakara) by Vaḍiyamaseṭṭi to the Bhōgēśvara-maṭha at Mudgaḍe. The interest derived from the amountwas to be used for feeding the ascetics and the students inthe maṭha. Mentions twelve gāvuṇḍas, in connection withthe preservation of the dharma.
71
Placement
Same slab
Year
…
King
…
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikrama-Varsha [10], Phāl-guna.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Seems to register gifts of oil, land,etc., to the god Nakarēśvara and to the maṭha of the Bhōgē-śvara temple by several persons. Mentions Mādiyabbe andKalidēva.

Placement

King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa

Damaged and worn out. In characters of about the 10thcentury A.D. Seems to contain the description of thebravery of some warrior, name not clear.
73
Placement

…
King

Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Mutilated and worn out. In characters of about the 12thcentury A.D. Praises the Kuntala-dēśa and the town Vēṇu-pura in it.

76
Placement
Broken slab lying near the Hāḷa Kallap-pana guḍi.
Year
Do.
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
Pushya, śu. 13,Sunday, Uttarā-yaṇa.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Worn out. Invokes the Jinaśāsana. Describes Rishisṛiṁgiand its six gāvuṇḍas. Mentions Attimabbe, Dēvarasa andKalidēva-śeṭṭi. Registers gifts of land, oil, etc., to a basadiby Bāchi Gāvuṇḍa and others (details lost). Mentions theJaina teacher Gaṇḍavi[mukta] Siddhāntidēva.

Year
Do.
King
Tribhuvanamalla
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks

79
Placement
Slab set up near the Mūru-Kaḷasada guḍi
Year
Do.
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
Chāḷukya-Vikrama-kāla 45, Śubhakṛit,Pushya, ba. 13,Sunday, Uttarā-yaṇa-saṅkrānti.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Commences with the praise of the gods Tṛi-kaḷēśvara and Gaṁgēśvara. Registers an endowment ofland including a flower garden for the daily worship andperiodical festivals of the god Gaṁgēśvara and feeding andclothing of the ascetics living in the maṭha attached to itby the Thirty Representatives (mūvadiṁbaru) of Soval.The gift was made into the hands of Kaliyuga-siddha Abhina-va-Pāśupata Brahmachāri Gaṁgarāśi. Seems to referto the consecration of the god Gaṁgēśvara by Gaṁgarāśi.
80
Placement
Śrīraṁgapūr.--Detached stone pedestallying outside the village.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 11th century A.D. States that it(the pedestal) was endowed by Kandiyamma, son of Mallasara-Kāḷiyamma, the gāvuṇḍa of Modalūr.
81
Placement
Slab kept near Goḍachi Vīrabhadra temple
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 14th century A.D. Mentions theŚaka year 31 (!) Viḷambi, Chaitra, Sunday and the Chāḷukya-Chakravarti. Satyāśrayadēva and states that gifts of landwere made to the twenty gavuṇḍas of Modalūr by Honna-koṁtada Māḷeya. The boundaries of the village are stated.The purpose of the gift is not clear The record seems to bea forgery. Below that is engraved in late characters thegift of a maṭha and land. Mentions the god GoḍachiVīrabhadra.

Saṁkamadēva ruḷing from [Maṁ-gaḷa]vāḍa.
Date

SHOLAPUR DISTRICT PANDHARPUR TALUK
91
Placement
Paṇḍharpūr.--Stone pilaster built as abeam in the roof of the outer maṇḍapa ofthe eastern side of the Viṭṭhala temple.
Year
Hoysaḷa
King
Vīra Sōmēśvara
Date
Śaka 1159, Durmukhi,Pushya, ba. 11,Uttarāyaṇa-saṁ-krānti.
Language and Script
Nāgarī script, Sanskrit & Kannaḍa verse & prose
Remarks
Damaged. Registers gift of two hundred varāhas for theconduct of daily worship, perpetual lamps and other perqui-sites of the god Śrī-Viṭhṭhala at Pamḍaraṁge on the riverBhīmarathī by the king for his welfare while he was camp-ing in the neighbourhood after his victorious campaign againsthis rivals. Among these is mentioned the Kāḍavarāya.
JATH STATE
92
Placement
Aṅkaḷagi.--Slab set up in the Hanumāntemple.
Year
Yādavas of Dēvagiri
King
Bhillama
Date
5th year, Sādhāraṇa,Vaiśākha, śu. 10,Monday, Uttarā-yaṇa-saṁkramaṇa.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records a votive offering of money into the handsof Gaṁgajīya for the benefit of the god Sōmanātha at Aṁku-lage by the headman (prabhu) Chāvuṁḍeya-Nāyaka, theMēlāḷike-adhikāri Kupparasa Daṁḍanāyaka, all the resi-dents, mānyakāras, Eṇṭuhiṭṭu, etc.
93
Placement
Slab lying in the Mesappana tōṭa.
Year
Kaḷachurya
King
Saṁkamadēva
Date
Year, 3, Viḷambi,Phālguṇa, śu. 3,Sunday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Broken and damaged. Seems to record some gift (details ofwhich are lost) to the deity (name lost) by [Cha]vuṁḍayya-Nāyaka. This deity is described as Mahā-yōgēśvarī, Ugra-Chāvuṁḍe, Khaṭvāṁga-kamaḷa-triśūla-ḍamaruga-karāḷa-haste, Keṁjeḍe-makuṭa-chaturbhuja-kōmaḷāṁgi, Ādinātheof sixty four yōgapīṭhas and residing at the holy seat (divya-sthāna) of the glorious (Śrīmat) Aṁkuḷage.
94
Placement
Bablād (Kontevvana).--Slab built inthe wall of the mosque.
Year
Ādil Shahi
King
Ibrahim II. Ādil Shah
Date
A.H. 1000 (A.D.1591).
Language and Script
Arabic & Persian
Remarks
States that the mosque was built in the time of Ibrahim ĀdilShah, by one Abdar Khan.
95
Placement
Bagēwādi.--Two pieces of a slab lying inthe Majumdar's well.
Year
…
King
…
Date
1st Jumāda, A.H.1005, (A.D. 1596,December, 21).
Language and Script
Persian
Remarks
Records the endowment of a well, a plot of land and a gardenby Malik Shaikh Alauddin, son of Malik Kamal, son of MalikBuzrug. Also states that after Shaik Alauddin the aboveproperty will be inherited by one Sahib Khan.
96
Placement

Year
Kaḷachurya
King
(Bijjaḷa ?)
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks

97
Placement
Bīḷūr.--Slab standing near Basavaṇṇa-dēvara Guḍi.
Year
Yādavas of Dēvagiri
King
Siṁhaṇa
Date
Śaka 1168, Viśvā-vasu, Pushya, ba.Amāvāsye, Mon-day, solar eclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Registers gifts of land, flower-garden,house-site, oil-mill, etc., for the conduct of daily worship andother rituals, feeding the Brahmins, etc., in the three templesof Bhāgalēśvara, Kaṁnagōpāla and [Bai]jalēśvara erected atBīḷūr by Viṁchuva Basavarasa of the Gautama-gōtra for themerit of the deceased Bhāgubaye(yi). Basavarasa wasBāhattaraniyōgādhipati and Sarvādhikāri to VāsudēvaKaṁnuva-Paṁḍita who was governing the districts of Heḍa-Kaṇaṁbaḍe and Tarddavāḍi from Vijayāpura. Bīḷūr(Bilavura)was situated in the Kaṇambaḍe-nāḍu, included in [Karahaṭṭa],which formed a part of Kuṁtala-vishaya.
98
Placement
Another slab standing in the same place.
Year
Yādavas of Dēvagiri
King
Siṁhaṇa, ruling from Dēvagiri
Date
Śaka 1168, Viśvā-[vasu].
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Records gifts of house-site, oil mill,wet lands, etc., for the daily worship of the god Basavēśvarawhose temple was constructed at Bīḷūr by Viṁchuva Basa-varasa of the Gautama-gōtra. Bīḷūr was situated in theKaṇabaḍe-nāḍu included in the Karahaḍa-dēśa which formeda part of Kuṁtala-vishaya. Basavarasa was the sarvādhi-kāri of Vēsugidēva son of Bhāgubāyi and his minister Kaṁṇuva Paṁḍita who were governing the districts of Tarda-vāḍi and Heḍa Kaṇabaḍe from their headquarters at Vijayāpura as subordinates of the king.

Placement
Slab lying in Kaṁbāra Mallappa Nirvāṇi'shouse.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Chāḷukya Bhūlōkayear 9, Ānanda,Āshāḍha, Amāvāsye,Monday, solareclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Mutilated. Registers gift of land and money income atBiyaḷavura by Mahāpradhāna Daṇḍanāyaka Kimirapavya,Manevergaḍe Ayamarasa, etc., for the worship, offerings, etc.,of the god [Mallikārjuna]dēva and the feeding of ascetics.
100
Placement
Guḍḍāpūr.--Slab set up in the Dānamma'stemple.
Year
Kaḷachurya
King
Saṁkamadēva (II)
Date
4th year, Parābhava,Pushya, śu. 14,Monday, [Uttarā]-yaṇa-saṁkrāṁti.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Registers a gift of land for thebenefit of the god Vīra-Sōmanātha of Nāyiṁṭige. Thegift was made into the hands of Vīrabrata-kshētrasaṁnyāsiRēvaiya. Mentions the female devotee Guḍḍiyavve.
101
Placement
Same slab
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
Sōmēśvara [IV]
Date
2nd year, Plavaṅga,Pushya, amāvāsyā,Monday, solareclipse, Uttarāyaṇa-seṁkramaṇa.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Registers gift of the village Sōraḍifor the benefit of the god Guḍive-pṛiya Svayaṁbhu-Sōma-nātha, by the king and his officer Mahāpradhāna Sēnādhi-pati Prachaṁḍa-Daṁḍanāyaka Bammidēvarasa from theircamp at Hū-Baṁnūru. The gift was made into the handsof Vīrabrati-kshētrasaṁnyāsi Sakaiya Taileyagaḷu. Someother gifts of land into his hands are also registered.

103
Placement
Kōḷgiri.--Slab set up in the temple ofBhairavanātha in a valley near thevillage.
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
Chaḷukyēśvara Vik-rama-kāla 11, Pra-bhava, Vaiśākha,puṇṇame, lunareclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers the endowment of the village Kōḷegira attached toKaṇaṁbaḍe Three Hundred (district) for the benefit of the godKēdārēśvara into the hands of Amṛitarāsi-Paṇḍita whenMahāmaṇḍalēśvara Jōgamarasa of the Kaḷachurya familywas governing the province of Karahāḍa. Also records giftof toll revenue of the village to the god Iṁdrēśvara consec-rated in his own name by Pergaḍe Iṁdapayya, who was theamātya of Jōgamarasa.

107
Placement
Saṁkha.--Slab set up in the KumbāraDēgula.
Year
Do.
King
Saṁkamadēva
Date
Śaka 1100 (in words),Viḷaṁbi, Māgha,Amāvāsyā, Sunday,solar eclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers an endowment of the village Karaṁdige situated inthe kaṁpaṇa, of Aṁkuḷage Fifty included in the Tarikāḍa-nāḍu for the benefit of the gods Māṇikēśvara, Nāgēśvaraand Maiḷalēśvara and for feeding the ascetics. The gift wasmade by the king at the request of Mahāpradhāna MasayiyaSāhaṇi. The temples of these gods were erected by Masayiyato perpetuate his own name and the names of his father andmother respectively at Saṁka in the Tarikāḍa-nāḍu.
108
Placement
Same slab
Year
Do.
King
Vīra Bijjaladēva, son of Rāya-MurāriSōyidēva.
Date
Parīdhāvi, Phālguṇa,Paurṇamāse, Mon-day, lunar eclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers an endowment of the village Āsage included inAṁkuḷage Fifty for the benefit of the gods mentioned inthe above record. Gifts of land, garden, oil mill, etc., madeby several persons and trading communities are also recorded.
109
Placement
Do.
Year
Yādavas of Dēvagiri
King
Jaitrapāḷadēva
Date
Ānanda, Kārtika,śu. 12, Monday.
Language and Script
…
Remarks
Registers an endowment, of the village Araḷige-Khairaḷigesituated in Aṁkuḷage Fifty for the benefit of god Māṇi-kēsvara and for feeding ascetics, made by the king at therequest of Masayiya-Sāhaṇi. The gift was made into thehands of Amarēśvara-Paṁḍita who was the sthānāchāryaof the Svayaṁbhū-Śri-Rāmēśvara-Tīrtha, situated to thesouth of the village, Uṁbaravāṇi in the district of KarahaḍaFour-Thousand, and whom Masayiya-Sāhaṇi installed as thesthānāchārya of the god Māṇikēśvara also.

111
Placement

Language and Script
Marāṭhī
Remarks

114
Placement
Tikoṇḍi.--Slab set up near Svami-guḍi
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
[Tribhuvanamalladēva ?]
Date

Remarks

115
Placement
Same slab
Year
Kaḷachurya
King
Rāyamurāri Sōvidēva
Date
5th year, Khara,Kārtika, śu. 5,Thursday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Registers gifts of land, oil-mill, oil,garden, etc., to the god Bhōgēśvara at Sāira by MahāsāmantaMācharasa of the Gōmuva family. It records further giftsof tolls on pack-horses and pack-donkeys by Suṁka-veggaḍeSoṁvarasa Daṇḍanāyaka.
116
Placement
Another slab set up in the same place
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. In characters of about the 12thcentury A.D. Registers gift of land and toll income bySuṁka-vergaḍe Vā[ma]rasa Nayāka to the god Kēdārēś-vara at [Lo]kkikuṇḍi. Praises Kēdāraśakti-Paṇḍitadēvaof the Bhujañgāvaḷi lineage, who was the sthānāchārya of thegod, and one Mācheya-Sāmanta.
117
Placement
Umadi.--Broken slab lying near Rāma-ṇṇa Kulkarni's house.
Year
Kaḷachurya
King
Rāyamurāri Sōvidēva ruling from thenelevīḍu at Maṁgaḷivēḍa.
Date
9th year, Manmatha,Phālguṇa, śu. Puṇ-ṇami, Thursday.
Language and Script
Sanskrit verse & Kannaḍa prose in Kannaḍa script
Remarks
Begins with five verses in praise of Śiva, Nārāyaṇa and othergods. Registers gifts of land, garden, oil-mill, etc., for thebenefit of the main god Jalaśayana Nārāyaṇa amidst twelveNārāyaṇas consecrated at Uṁmade by MahāpradhānaMahāvaḍḍavyavahārin Nāgadēvayya-Nāyaka, the Mūligas,the Eṇṭu Hiṭṭu, Pañcha-ṁaṭhasthāna, Aruvattokkalu (sixtytenants) all the Baṅaṁju and other groups at the instanceof the king and with the approval of the five ministers (Paṁ-cha-Pradhāna). Describes in detail in Sanskrit verse thegenealogy of Nāgadēva who is said to have been born in thesolar race.
118
Placement
Umarāni.--Slab set up at the right wallin the Hēmaliṅga temple.
Year
Do.
King
Bhujabalamalla
Date
Śaka 1089 (in words),Sarvajit, Vaiśākha,Amāvāsye, Monday,solar eclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Registers a gift of land and oil-mill for the benefitof the temples of Hemmēśvara and Chandalēśvara at Uṁ-baravāṇi by Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Hemmāḍi, DaṇḍanāyakaMaduvaṇayya and other Karaṇas at the instance of theking. This Hemmāḍi bore the title Kopaṇa-puravarādhīś-vara and was the lord of Uṁbaravāṇi (modern Umarāṇi),the chief town of the thirty-six villages situated in the Kaḷaṁ-baḍe-nāḍu, which was included in Karahaḍa Four-Thou-sand province of the Kuṁtala-dēśa. Also states that Madu-vaṇayya Daṁḍanāyaka and Mallidēva-Daṇḍanāyaka weregoverning the province of Heḍa-Kaḷambaḍe-nāḍu.
119
Placement
Same slab
Year
Do.
King
Rāyamurāri Bhujabalamalla Gaṁyi-dēvarasa (Sōyidēva ?)
Date
Śaka 1096 (in words)Vijaya, Jyēshṭha,amāvāsye, Monday,solar eclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers a gift of land at Basurige for the benefit ofgod Hemmēśvara and feeding the ascetics by the queenChandaladēvī who transferred it to the king, at whose instanceit (the land) was assigned as a sarva-namasya endowment byKappadēva Gōpati Daṁḍanāyaka and other Karaṇas.
120
Placement
Slab set up near the left wall in the sametemple.
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date
Śaka 1044 (in words),Śubhakṛit, Māgha,Amāvāsye, Monday,solar eclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Registers a gift of land, oil, garden, tolls, etc.,for the benefit of the temple of god Hemmēśvara byChandaladēvī and her son, Polakēsidēva-Vanasiṁhadēva.This temple was erected in the name of her husband byChandaladēvī, who was the crowned queen (Paṭṭa-mahādēvī)of Mahāmaṇḍalēśvara Hemmāḍidēva of the Chāḷukyalineage at their capital Uṁbaravāṇi. Mentions prince(kumāra) Mallikārjuna.
121
Placement
On the same slab.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1064 (in words),Duṁdubhi, Chai-tra, puṇṇave, Mon-day, Vishu-saṁkra-maṇa.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Records the conferment of the sthāna of godHemmēśvara with all its endowments on Chandrābharaṇa-Paṇḍitadēva, who was the sthānāchārya of god Tīrthada-Śrī-Svayaṁbhū Rāmēśvara, by the Paṭṭa-mahādēviChaṁdaladēvī and prince Banasiṁhadēva, who had erectedthe temple of the said god. Also registers the gift of land andhouse-site to god Vukkēśvara of the Mūlasthāna,evidently by the same donors.

124
Placement
Wajasaṅga.--Slab set up on the right sideof the entrance to the Mahādēva temple.
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva, ‘ruling fromJayantīpura.’
Date
18th year, Śrīmukha,Chaitra, amāvāsye,Monday, solareclipse, Vyatīpāta.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers an endowment of land to god Lakkhaṇēśvaraof Vaḷasaṁga, situated in Kalaṁbaḍe Three-Hundred dis-trict by Piriyarasi Lakhmādēvī, Mahāsāmanta Dāyarasa,the Prabhu, the Mūligas, the Mahājanas, etc., of the two kērīs.Mahāmaṇḍaḷēśvara Jōgamarasa was then governing theprovince of Karahaḍa Four-Thousand.
125
Placement
Same slab
Year
Do.
King
Jagadēkamalla
Date
7th year (in words),Rudhirōdgāri, Kār-tika, puṇṇame,Monday, lunareclipse, Vyatīpāta.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers gifts of land for the daily worship and offeringsof god Lakhkhaṇēśvara (of Vaḷasaṁga) by MahāsāmantaBaṁmadēvarasa, who was the Manneya of Saygāve Thirty-six villages.
126
Placement
Do.
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
8th year (in wordsand figure), Krōd-hana, Phālguna,puṇname, Monday,lunar eclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers gifts of tolls, oil-mill, oil, etc., to the gods Lakkaṇ-ēśvara, Kēśavadēva and Mūlasthāna-Kalidēva of Vala-saṁga by Mahāmaṇḍāḷēśvara Kumāra-Rājayadēvarasa, whowas governing the Kalaṁbaḍe-nāḍu. Also records a gift ofoil for a perpetual lamp to the gods by the Telligas (oil-mongers).
127
Placement
Slab set up on the left side of the entranceto the same temple.
Year
Do.
King
Do
Date
10th year (in words),Uttamavisigi, Pra-bhava, Pushya, śu.[11], Monday, Utta-rāyaṇa-saṁkrānti.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out. Registers gifts of land, house-site,etc., when Mahāmaṇḍaḷēśvara [Gōhaṇa]rasa was governingthe province of Karahaḍa Four-Thousand, by PergaḍeHēchimayya, Mummuridaṇḍas, etc., for the benefit of somecharity founded by one Maili-seṭṭi. Mentions a certainMahāsāmanta bearing the titles, Lattalūrapuravarādhīś-vara, Suvarṇa-garuḍa-dhvaja, etc.
128
Placement
Slab built into a wall inside the sametemple.
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
Do
Date
5th year, Duṁdubhi,Pushya, śu. 10,Monday, Uttarā-yaṇa-saṁkrānti.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers a gift of land for a charity pickota at Vaḷasaṁgaby Sāvanta Handarasa and the headman Chauḍamayya,when Mahāmaṇḍaḷēśvara Bijjaṇadēva was governing theprovince of Karahaḍa Four-Thousand and his grandmotherAbhinava-Chandaladēvī was administering Vaḷasaṁga,situated in Kaḷaṁbaḍe Three-Hundred division. Thelast named is described as Abhinava-Śāradādēvī and asthe wife of Tribhuvanamalladēva (Vikramāditya VI).

135
Placement
Sides of pillars in the Kāśī-Viśvēśvaratemple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śālivāhana Śaka,1494, Āṁgirasa,Dakshiṇāyaṇa, Var-sharitu, Bhādra-pada, śu. 3, Mon-day, Hastā nak-shatra, Sādhyayōga,Taitila-karaṇa.
Language and Script
Marāthī
Remarks
Records the renovation of the temple to the left of the wellnamed Jōgi-Bāvi and the installation of the Viśvanāthaliṅga and provision for its daily worship, etc., at Maṅgaḷa-vēḍha by Kaḷaiyadēva, the Kuḷakaraṇi of Hiparage whenhe was in charge of the majamu of the paragaṇe. Kaḷai-yadēva belonged to the Bhāradvāja-gōtra and Vātsyāyana-sūtra and was a Śukla-yajuh2-śākhādhyāvī. Published inthe Marāṭhi journal, Granthamālā, Vol. XI, No. 11.

Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1941-42.

Year

…
Date
6th November, 1818A.D.
Language and Script
English
Remarks
States that the slab was set up in memory of Captain JamesCooke of H.M. 84th regiment, who fell a victim to choleraat Hubli.

Language and Script
English
Remarks
States that the slab was set up in memory of the Non-commi-ssioned officers and privates of the Flank companies ofH.M. 34th, 53rd, 69th and 84th regiments who died atHubli, by their surviving comrades.
7
Placement
Amaragōḷ.--Slab set up near the Bana-saṅkari temple.
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
Tribhuvanamalladēva
Date

Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records that Mahāpradhāna Saudhore Jakkarasa erectedthe temples, installed the gods Kēśava and Bhairava thereinand made an endowment of land at Aṁbaragōḷa situatedin the Uṇakal kaṁpaṇa of the Halasige-nāḍu for their worship.The gift was entrusted into the hands of Dēvarāsi Paṇ-ḍita.

Year
…
King
…
Date

Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that the Jaina ascetic Kanakanandi, of the Dhora-jinālaya at Sabbi expired by the vow of samni(nya)sana.The nisidhige was set up in his memory by the nun Bhāgi-vabbe. Vajra composed the epitaph and Nākiga inscribedit.

Date
Śaka 1784
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
States that the gong was prepared from another broken onewhich was in the possession of the Anantanātha-basti atHaḷe Hubbaḷḷi for the past 1100 years.
36
Placement
Hubbaḷḷi.--A slab kept in the Mamalat-dar's office compound.
Year
Rāshṭrakūṭa
King
Amōghavarshadēva
Date
Śaka 895, Śrīmukha,Jyēshṭha, ba. 8,Sunday, Dakshi-ṇāyana saṁkrānti.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records a gift of land for the construction of a tank by Mori-yara Kali-bhiṭṭayya when Guttiya Gaṁga Permānaḍi wasgoverning Beḷvala--300, Purigare--300 and Gaṁgavāḍi--96,000 and when his subordinate was administering thevillages Nīrgoṇḍi.

Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and worn out.

41
Placement
Kaṭnūr.--Pillar built in a wall insideKaḷamēśvara temple.
Year
Kadaṁba
King
Śivachitta Vīra Tribhuvanamalla-dēva.
Date
17th year, Śubhakṛit,Kārtika, śu.Puṇṇami, Mon-day.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers a gift of land for the benefit of the temple of ŚrīMūlasthānadēva at Kaṭṭanūru after renovation by Indeya-Sāhiṇi when Mahāpasāyita Māsāḍa Hiṭṭeya Nāyaka wasruling over the place.
42
Placement
Nandi-pillar standing in a dilapidatedshrine.
Year
Yādava
King
Rāmachandradēva
Date
Śaka 1..... ..,Pushya, ba. 10,Sunday, Uttarā-yaṇa- sa[ṁkra-maṇa].
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers the endowment, with the permission of the king, ofthe village Kaṭṭanūr along with all its resources included inSabbi--30 situated in the [Dāra]vāḍa division which formeda part of Palasige 12,000, for the benefit of the god Kapila-siddha Mallikārjunadēva of Soṁnaḷige-kshētra by the ministerand Sarvādhikāri Nāgadēva who was administering from hisheadquarters at Dāravāḍa.
43
Placement
Hero stone in Sur. No. 14 near the village
Year

King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In characters of about the 9th century A.D. Records thedeath in a cattle raid at Kaṭṭanūr of Kaṭṭli-Tāṇaga and hisson Taṭṭapa against Komāra.

45
Placement
Majīdpur.--(suburb of Hubli).--Slab setup on a tomb in the Hosamaṭha.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Modern. States that it is the gadduge (tomb) of BasappaKāḍappa Seṭṭaru, a resident of Mahajitapura and a devoutfollower of the Vīraśaiva tenets.

51
Placement
Slab set up in Sur. No. 217 near the village
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
Bhuvanaikamalladēva
Date
Śaka 994, Parīdhāvi,Chaitra, śu. 8,Monday, Uttarā-yaṇa-samkrānti.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers the gift of certain shares in the harvests made to theāchārya Sōmakarttāra by the twelve gāvuṁḍas of Nūle inthe Halasige province of Kuntala when the Kadaṁba kingMahāmaṇḍalēśvara Chaṭṭayadēva was ruling over Koṁkaṇa--900 and his son Jayakēśidēva with his queen Boppādēvī,was governing the provinces of Koṁkaṇa--900, Halasige--12,000, Kundūru 300 and Sabbi--30 from dapital Gōve.
52
Placement
Same slab
Year
Kadaṁba
King
Śivachitta-Vīra-Permāḍi-Vijayāditya-dēva.
Date
[30th] year, Viśvā-vasu, Āshāḍha, ba.amāvāśye, Sunday,solar eclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Records gift of land, house-site, etc., to Kāḷēśvarārya byAppaṇa Daṇḍanāyaka and the twelve (gāvuṁḍas) at theinstance of the king.

Kannaḍa

59
Placement
Varūr.--Hero stone set up near theHanumān temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
29th year, Hēvi-ḷaṁbi, Chaitra, śu.12, Friday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Seems to record the death of Elevaḷēya Bijjaya and Jakkarasason of Saṅkaya in an encounter between Bhairava Khaṁ-ḍērāya Saṁgarasa, the adhikāri of Nūle and Hirugidēva themaṇḍalika of Beḷagaḷe.

Stone inscriptions in the Bombay-Karnatak copied during the year 1942-43.


BELGAUM DISTRICT HUKERI TALUK

Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged and fragmentary. Mentions Traikīrtti, theYāpanīya-saṅgha and some gaṇa (name lost).
7
Placement
Slab lying on the roadside near the girl'sschool.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1505, Subhānu,Jyēshṭha, śu. 12,Sunday.
Language and Script
Marāṭhi in Nāgarī
Remarks
Mentions two names viz., Malik bhāī bin Sēkh MāhāmadaKhatīb and Mulā Husain. Mulā Māhāmada, (this andNo. 14 below were kindly deciphered for the Dept.by Mr. G.H. Khare).
8
Placement
Slab kept in the taluk office (removed tothis place from Arjunwāḍ).
Year
Yādavas of Dēvagiri
King
Kannaḍa
Date
Śaka 1182, Siddhār-thin, Chaitra, ba.Amāvāsyā, Monday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Published in Epigraphia Indica, Vol. XXI, pages 9 ff.
9
Placement
Bhairāpūr.--A Slab lying in a field abouthalf a mile to the south of the village.
Year
Raṭṭa
King
Mahāmāṇḍalēśvara Vīra Lakshmī-dēvarasa, ‘ruling from Vēṇugrāma’.
Date
Śaka 1159, Dur-mukhi, Śrāvaṇa,śu. 11, Monday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers a grant of land, house and (site for) haystack(baṇaṁbe) made by the queen Laliteyadēvī, at Mattivāḍawhich was under her administration, to MahāpradhānaŚēnāpati Nāgeya-Nāyaka for the maintenance of the Mūvattir-chchasira-chhatra (feeding house) at Nākēśvara.
10
Placement
Ammaṇagi.--Stone set up near the imageof Hanumān in front of the Svayaṁbhū-Mallikārjuna temple.
Year
…
King
…
Date
…
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
In late characters. An imprecation on those who do not takea bath in the holy pond.
11
Placement
Stone lying near the ruined temple ofRāmaliṅga.
Year
…
King
…
Date
Śaka 1179, Naḷa,Pushya, śu. [7],Monday, Utta-rāyaṇa-saṁkrānti.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Damaged. Seems to record a gift of land after purchase, by theMahājanas to the temple of the goddess for its maintenance.
12
Placement
Kōchari.--Slab set up near the temple ofHanumān.
Year
Western Chāḷukya
King
Trailōkyamalladēva
Date
Śaka 97[8], Man-matha, Āśvayuja,śu. Puṇṇame,Sunday, lunareclipse.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Badly damaged. Seems to register some gifts to the templeof Trikūṭēśvara. The details are lost.
13
Placement
Beḷḷaṁbi.--Slab lying near the house ofWali Siddappa-Mallappa.
Year
Raṭṭa
King
Mahāsāmanta Aṅkayyarasa
Date
Śaka 973, Khara,Śrāvaṇa, ba. 3,Saṅkrānti,Sunday.
Language and Script
Kannaḍa
Remarks
Registers a gift of money made into the hands of the 50 Mahā-janas of Beḷuvabbe headed by the ūroḍeya Kāḷidāsayya, formaintaining a free feeding house (satra) for Brāhmans.
14
Placement
Slab lying near the temple of Narasiṁha
Year
Yādavas of Dēvagiri
King
Kṛishṇadēva
Date
Śaka 1169, Plavaṅga,Āshāḍha, ba. 1,Thursday.
Language and Script
Marāṭhī in Nāgarī
Remarks
Records the grant of some sites for houses and oil mills made tothe village deity of Biḷḷibi by a person whose name is notclear in the inscription. Mentions Daḷavāy BhōgadēvaYādava.
